[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/16-simple-saving-tips-for-the-new-year/)

Menjelang tahun baru, mudah untuk mengatakan *“Saya akan menyimpan lebih banyak pada tahun ini!”* tetapi perkara yang anda mungkin tidak fikirkan ialah *“Bagaimana saya boleh menyimpan lebih banyak tahun ini? Apakah cara praktikal untuk melakukannya?”.*

Tidak kira sebab apa anda menyimpan wang – sama ada untuk mencapai target simpanan, melangsaikan hutang dengan lebih cepat atau merancang untuk percutian atau rumah pertama – cadangan mudah ini akan membantu anda mencapainya dengan lebih cepat.

Dengan 16 tip mudah, pasti akan ada sekurang-kurangnya satu yang sesuai dengan anda yang boleh membantu anda untuk kekal konsisten ke arah mencapai matlamat tahun baru ini!

1.  __Manjakan diri anda dengan hadiah hari jadi yang percuma.__ Kebanyakan restoran, jika anda memberitahu mereka hari ini ialah hari jadi anda, mereka akan memberikan anda sesuatu (seperti kek percuma, diskaun dan sebagainya).
2.  Selongkar laci anda untuk mendapatkan __“gift card”__ (seperti baucar diskaun) yang masih belum digunakan. Jika anda mungkin tidak akan menggunakannya, hadiahkan atau jualkannya.
3.  __Batalkan langganan__ majalah, keahlian gimnasium dan lain-lain __sekiranya anda tidak gunanya lagi.__
4.  __Tutup paip sinki apabila anda memberus gigi.__ Ini boleh menjimatkan 5,000 liter air setahun, dalam masa yang sama dapat mengurangkan bil utiliti anda. Juga, jangan mandi lama sangat!
5.  __Cabut plag komputer riba anda dan peralatan lain apabila__ anda tidak menggunakannya. Meninggalkan komputer anda sepanjang hari boleh menambah sehingga ratusan ringgit bil dalam setahun.
6.  __DIY apabila ia masuk akal.__ Melakukan pembaikan besar boleh menjimatkan wang anda! YouTube sahaja untuk belajar :D.
7.  __Buat senarai sebelum pergi ke kedai dan berpegang padanya__ – dan elakkan membeli-belah apabila anda lapar :D.
8.  __Beli dengan diskaun__ apabila anda berbelanja untuk pembelian besar seperti perabot dan barangan elektrik.
9.  __Pinjam__. Rakan anda mungkin memiliki pakaian sut hitam yang juga boleh anda pakai untuk acara-acara yang hanya setahun sekali :D.
10.  __Pinjam buku di perpustakaan__. Tak perlu beli :D.
11.  __Beli barangan harian seperti__ tisu dan lampin bayi __secara pukal__.
12.  __Buat kopi sendiri,__ penjimatan sehingga RM10 setiap minuman!
13.  __Berkomitmen untuk membawa bekal makan tengah hari anda.__
14.  __Cari aktiviti alternatif di bandar anda,__ seperti senaman pagi di taman awam berbanding dengan melanggan keahlian gim.
15.  __Sukarelawan.__ Ia merupakan aktiviti bermakna percuma dan akan membuatkan anda berasa gembira juga.

Akhirnya,

16.  __Set Target Simpanan pada akaun Raiz anda__. Ini cara mudah untuk mengukur kemajuan anda dan membuat pelarasan cepat.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Recurring-3.png)

Dengan ciri Target Simpanan kami, anda boleh menetapkan pelaburan berkala sama dengan hari gaji anda. Raiz juga membolehkan anda membuat pelaburan harian, mingguan, dua minggu atau bulanan secara automatik.

done.title: 3 Steps to Build Up Your Emergency Fund
done.description: It’s more important than ever to have emergency savings. Let’s do it.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/emergency_fund.jpg)

It’s more important than ever to have emergency savings. Let’s do it.

1.  __How much do you need?__

It’s important to build up an emergency savings fund to prepare for the unexpected, whether that’s your car breaking down or a drop in income. A rough guide for the ideal sum to have saved is the amount you’d need to cover __three months’__ essential outgoings. So, if you spend RM1,500 a month on mortgage or rent, food, bills and other things you can’t live without, aim for RM4,500 in emergency savings. But if this figure seems unrealistic, don’t be daunted by it. Even having just a small amount saved can help you avoid taking on debt if you face unexpected costs.

2.  __How much can you save?__

Work out how much you can afford to save each month. Go through your income and spending, there are many useful budget planners in app store (just search for “budget planner” for example).

See where you can cut back like if you can save on bills, for example, could you cut the cost of your phone bill by switching providers? This could be extra cash for your fund. Once you know how much you can afford to put away each month, try setting up a standing order that automatically puts money into your savings account each month to help you achieve your goal.

Try using less cash and instead more traceable sources such as debit cards, online banking and credit cards. This way you can monitor your money through statements and stay ahead of your finances.

3.  __Remember, it takes time!__

While you’ll want to get your emergency fund set up as soon as possible, like with all savings, it’s best to keep to what you can afford and make sure to save regularly.

Saving smaller but regular amounts are more effective than saving larger amounts now. This is because you __get into the habit of saving__ and also avoid overcommitting too much. It can help you budget more effectively too. Or just save what you can as regularly as you can. Every bit of cash saved makes a big difference to your financial wellbeing.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/rayakids.jpg)

Hari Raya adalah salah satu hari yang paling dinantikan oleh umat Islam di Malaysia. Keriangan sentiasa terpancar apabila kita berkumpul bersama ahli keluarga, menjamu selera dengan juadah Raya seperti ketupat, rendang dan kalau untung, dapat duit Raya!

Banyak persiapan yang perlu dibuat. Semestinya perbelanjaan juga akan menjadi banyak, kan?

Jom kita lihat cara jimat berbelanja untuk hari Raya:

__1\. Buat dan sediakan bajet__

Ya, bunyi agak *cliché* tetapi ianya sangat penting. Kalau kita lihat satu per satu, sebenarnya agak banyak yang perlu disenaraikan. Bajet untuk bahan makanan, baju Raya, duit Raya dan lain-lain mengikut perancangan hari Raya anda. Raya kali ini mungkin berlainan sedikit kerana musim pandemik. Anda mungkin boleh jimat dalam kos-kos tertentu, contohnya pengangkutan. Dengan senarai bajet ini, anda akan lihat the *big picture* dan merasa lebih tenang untuk berbelanja nanti.

__2\. Masak sendiri__

Anda yang tak dapat beraya di kampung tu, mesti terfikir untuk order je kan? Tidak salah, tetapi untuk lebih jimat, anda boleh cuba untuk masak dengan sendiri. Inilah masanya orang-orang muda terutamanya, untuk belajar resepi juadah hari Raya nanti.

__3\. Bersederhana ketika membeli-belah__

Apabila kita sudah ada bajet (no. 1), lebih mudah untuk kita membeli-belah. Ketika zaman pandemik ini, pergerakan lebih terhad dan kemungkinan untuk pergi beraya ke rumah sanak saudara juga kurang. Jadi, kita tidak perlu untuk membeli terlalu banyak bahan makanan sebagai persediaan untuk tetamu datang. Pakaian baru juga cukup dengan 1 set sahaja.

__4\. Beli-belah di kedai yang ada promosi diskaun__

Musim Raya ni tentulah banyak kedai yang buat promosi Raya. Jadi kalau boleh berjimat, kenapa bayar lebih? Juga boleh gunakan peluang jika ada baucer, *cashback*, *reward* dan sebagainya!

__5\. Simpan duit Raya baik-baik__

Tadi cerita tentang keluarkan duit dengan cara yang betul. Ini pula tentang cara nak simpan duit. Rugilah jika nak belanja semua duit Raya yang dapat, kan? Eloklah disimpan walaupun sedikit. Untuk anak-anak berumur 17 dan ke bawah, ibu bapa boleh menguruskannya melalui akaun [Raiz Kids](https://raiz.com.my/blog/raiz-kids-invest-in-your-kids-future/). done.description: Click here for English   Ramai di antara kita yang ingin membuat pelaburan tetapi terhenti atau terhalang disebabkan beberapa faktor. Dengar sahaja “pelaburan”, ramai yang takut dan kecut perut.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/wrong.jpg)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/4-myths-about-investing/)

Ramai di antara kita yang ingin membuat pelaburan tetapi terhenti atau terhalang disebabkan beberapa faktor. Dengar sahaja “pelaburan”, ramai yang takut dan kecut perut.

Ini mungkin disebabkan beberapa anggapan yang salah, lahir daripada pengetahuan yang kurang tentang pelaburan. Berikut adalah beberapa mitos berkenaan pelaburan yang anda patut tahu. Jom, kita belajar sama-sama!

__1\. Nak melabur kena banyak duit__

Sebenarnya, semua orang pun boleh melabur!

Ramai di antara kita tidak melabur kerana beranggapan bahawa kita memerlukan duit yang banyak untuk melabur. Sebut sahaja pelaburan, terus terfikir “Bursa Saham”, “Wall Street”, “duit berjuta-juta”.

Terdapat banyak cara pelaburan yang membolehkan kita melabur dengan jumlah yang kecil. Contohnya, Raiz membolehkan anda melabur dengan hanya menggunakan duit baki daripada perbelanjaan harian anda. Ya, dengan duit baki pun anda boleh melabur!

__2\. Terlalu muda untuk melabur__

Tiada sesiapa pun yang terlalu muda untuk melabur!

Bahkan, lebih awal anda bermula, lebih banyak kebaikan yang anda akan dapat. Perlu diingat bahawa pelaburan adalah untuk jangka masa yang panjang, dan bukanlah semata-mata untuk mendapatkan keuntungan secepat mungkin. Lebih panjang jangka masa anda melabur, lebih besar ‘*compounding effect*’ yang anda akan lihat.

__3\. Terlalu banyak risiko dalam pelaburan__

Mesti pernah dengar cerita orang yang kehilangan duit kerana salah labur. Benar, dalam sesebuah pelaburan, mesti ada risiko. Ketahui apa risiko yang mampu anda ambil yang selari dengan matlamat kewangan anda. Anda mungkin boleh berjumpa dengan penasihat kewangan untuk mendapatkan nasihat.

Dan jangan lupa, sekiranya sesebuah ‘pelaburan’ itu menjanjikan pulangan yang kedengaran seperti tidak masuk akal, kemungkinan besar ianya “scam”. Jangan mudah tertipu. Yang paling penting, pastikan syarikat tersebut berdaftar dan mempunyai lesen daripada Suruhanjaya Sekuriti Malaysia.

Baca [sini](https://raiz.com.my/blog/adakah-selamat-melabur-dengan-raiz-baca-ini/).

__4\. Perlukan banyak pengetahuan tentang pasaran__

Benar, mempunyai ilmu pengetahuan adalah penting sebelum melabur. Tetapi kami juga faham, anda mungkin tidak mempunyai masa atau minat. Memadai dengan mempunyai pengetahuan am tentang kewangan dan pelaburan, yang lain, serahkan pada yang pakar! Banyak syarikat pengurus dana professional berlesen di luar sana – Raiz adalah salah satunya.

With the new year upon us, it’s easy to say *“I will save more this year”* but what you might not have brainstormed is *“How can I save more this year? What are the practical ways to go about it?”*

The good news is that even small efforts can add up to big savings over time. No matter what you’re saving money for —whether it’s to reach a savings goal, pay off debt faster or plan ahead for a holiday or first home—these simple suggestions will help you get there faster.

With 16 simple suggestions, there is surely at least one that would suit you and willhelp you stick to your goal or resolutions this year!

1.  __Treat yourself to a birthday freebie.__ Most restaurants, if you tell them it’s your birthday, will give you a little something just for dining with them. The key is signing up to be a member early.
2.  Raid your drawers for unused __gift cards.__If you probably won’t put them to good use, re-gift or sell them.
3.  __Cancel unused subscriptions for__ magazines, gym memberships, for example.
4.  __Turn off the tap when you brush your teeth.__ This can save 5,000L per year, cutting down your utility bill. Also, take shorter showers.
5.  __Unplug your laptop and other appliances when__ you aren’t using them. Leaving your computer on all day could add up to hundreds of ringgitin a year.
6.  __DIY when it makes sense.__ Doing major repairs on your own won’t save you money if you end up having to pay a pro to fix your shoddy work.
7.  __Make a list before hitting the store____ and____ stick to it__—and avoid grocery shopping when you’re hungry and more likely to make impulse buys.
8.  __Buy for a discount when__ you’re shopping for big-ticket items like furniture or appliances.
9.  __Borrow__. A friend may own a black-suit outfit you can wear to an upcoming event.
10.  __Get books at the library instead__ of purchasing your own copies.
11.  __Buy everyday items like__ vegetables and baby diapers __in bulk.__
12.  __Make your own coffee,__ saving you up to RM10 per drink.
13.  __Commit to bringing your lunch just__ one more day a week.
14.  __Look for alternative____ activities ____in your city__, like morning workouts in public parksas opposed to subscribing to a gym membership.
15.  __Volunteer.__ It’s a free meaningful activity and will make you feel good too.

Finally,

16.  __Create savings goals on your Raiz Account.__ It’s an easy way to measure your progress and make quick adjustments.

You can customise the goal name to keep you focused on what you are trying to achieve.

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Budgetting.jpg)

It’s commonly said that it takes money to make money. That is effectively true – those who live payslip to payslip with no spare cash have little to re-invest or save for emergency. However, if you take the time to re-evaluate your finances, you’ll realise that setting aside even the smallest of Ringgit amounts can add up over a lifetime.

__Remember these 3 numbers – 50/30/20__

It’s simple in principle and practice:

*   Use up to 50% of your income for what you need
*   Allow for up to 30% to spend on the fun stuff
*   Save 20% for emergency, invest or your savings goal.

These numbers aren’t necessarily fixed; however, they provide a strong foundation for building healthy financial habits to help you to set your workable ratio based life condition to achieve your financial goals.

__Pay yourself first__

When you get your paycheck, many people make the mistake of spending first, and then saving what is left over. The problem with this is that it doesn’t guarantee any savings; your savings become dependent on how much you spend each month (and often in a rather unplanned fashion).

A better strategy is to pay yourself first by setting aside a fixed percentage of your income towards saving and investing (for example the 20% from the numbers above), and then spending with what is left over.

Automation is your friend here, which effortlessly take out the money from your bank account before you have a chance to spend it. Setting up a recurring deposit into your Raiz account is one way to do this.

__Trimming the fat on your budget__

If you take a bird’s-eye view of your budget, you’ll soon see that there are a few types of expenses from your pay. You can think of them as this:

*   Investment/Emergency funds

*   Essential expenses you cannot change.
*   Essential expenses that you can control.
*   Non-essentials

The key is to make your essentials are efficient as possible by finding alternatives or shopping around. For example:

Many Malaysians forget that basic household bills like electricity, internet, and insurance can all be shopped and swapped. By switching providers, you can easily save hundreds off your annual spend!

Buy in bulk (within reason): you may look like a madman for a moment, but it pays off to buy non-quickly damaged essentials in bulk.

Try to pay for things upfront or on time – some providers will give discounts for on-time payments or bulk payments (e.g. annual premiums for insurance could be cheaper than monthly)

The Olympics is where the world’s best athletes compete for gold medals for their countries. We can see so many superhuman actions which non-athletes (like us) can’t do. 

There is a lot of lessons from the Olympics that can be applied to us when it comes to finance and investment.

__1\. Set a goal__

If we ask every one of them whether they have a goal, surely they do. It’s not an easy task to stay disciplined, training every single day. What drives them? Their goal. It’s common for athletes to train for years prior to joining the Olympic team. They need to plan ahead to ensure that they are in their best form when competing, so that they can achieve their goal.

Likewise, saving and investing are also not easy. Especially when there are too many sales going around (7/7, 6/6, 5/5… temptations). Setting a savings goal like a home deposit or retirement fund will help you to plan ahead and train you to consistently save money.

__2\. Start early__

It takes years of hard work to be the best. The earlier you start, the more time you have to practice and sharpen your skills. For example, the world’s best swimmer, Michael Phelps started swimming at the age of 8. At 15 years old, he became the youngest man on U.S. Olympic swim team at the 2000 Sydney Olympics.

Same goes for investing – the earlier we start, the better it will be! The sooner we start with savings and investing, the more time we will have to reap the benefit of [compounding](https://raiz.com.my/blog/could-compounding-interest-or-compounding-profit-truly-be-the-eighth-wonder-of-the-world/). Sikit-sikit, lama-lama jadi bukit.

__3\. Plan ahead__

An Olympian does not just magically appear out of thin air. Behind the athletes’ successes are years of dedicated hard work and a lot of planning and strategizing involved.

Likewise, investing success doesn’t happen overnight. Remember, investing is not a ‘get-rich-quick’ scheme. done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/payday.jpg)

Getting on top of your personal finances can be tough, and a common area where a lot of people fail is keeping their spending in check when payday rolls around.

That’s because when your salary lands in your bank account, it’s easy to spend too much and then not leave enough for savings and investing as well as all your fixed costs like rent and food.

But it doesn’t have to be this way. There are some easy tips you can follow to help manage your money around payday.

__Change your payday habits__

Managing your money at payday means having good routines in place. So, it’s a good idea to have a look at your usual spending habits at this time and see if anything needs to change. For instance, if you regularly spend half your pay on buying clothes online as soon as money lands in your bank account, then you probably need to reassess your spending in this area.

Indeed, if this sounds like you, it may be a good idea to schedule a different and less costly, or an activity you enjoy that won’t break your bank.

__Get your priorities straight__

Your spending priorities are also very important to get right on payday. Remember, if you want to manage your money smarter, and not get caught short before your next payday is due, it’s helpful to pay important things like mobile and internet, rent and insurances first.

Even better, why not consider setting up automatic deductions from your transactions account that can be timed for when your payday arrives. This will enable you to make important payments without having to lift a finger as well as more accurately budget.

__Set initiative to saving__

Living paycheck to paycheck makes saving money difficult as you either run out of cash before you have the chance to save, or you end up using your savings to cover regular bills.

Breaking this cycle can be tricky, but one option is to open a stand-alone savings account and then have a proportion of your salary automatically deposited into it.

__What about emergencies?__

Payday is not just about saving money or investing, it’s also about ensuring you’ll be okay if something unexpected happens. For many people, this means [having an emergency fund](https://raiz.com.my/blog/3-ways-to-build-up-your-emergency-fund/).

When it comes to an emergency fund, how much you’ll need will differ depending on your particular circumstances. But even so, it’s a good idea to reserve some of your pay for unexpected shocks like a death in the family, a medical emergency or a one-off payment.

__Want to invest? Think about automatic recurring deposits__

Many people, especially millennials, want to get into investing, but may not think they have the money. This could be due in part to financial mismanagement at payday. However, the good news is that mobile apps like Raiz are making it easier than ever to invest and put your money to work.

Setting up a recurring deposit into your Raiz account on payday will automatically invest a portion of your paycheck as you go about your daily life, taking a lot of the hassle out of your hands and removing the need to make big decisions on payday.

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Illusion.png)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/5-mitos-tentang-pelaburan/)

Thinking about investing in the share market, but there’s a voice inside your head that keeps telling you that “don’t”? Maybe you think you don’t have enough money, or perhaps you keep hearing that you might lose all you money!

Well, you’ll be glad to learn that most of these are just myths! Today, Raiz is here to help uncover five common misconceptions that should not stop you from investing in the share market.

### 1) “I don’t have enough money”.

A lot of people think you can only invest in the share market only if you’re rich but this is __far from the truth__. If you use a micro-investment app like Raiz, you can get started with as little as your spare change! Now, everyone can invest!

### 2) “It can wait”.

The thing with investing in the share market is that it’s a long-term gameplan – not a way to get rich overnight. The longer you’re invested, the more chance you have for your investment to grow in value.

### 3) “I don’t know enough about share market”.

The good news here is that you don’t need to know too much about share market to start investing! You might have seen your friends checking the performance of different stocks and carefully handpicking which ones to invest in. But this isn’t the case anymore.

Thanks to products called unit trust funds (UTFs), you don’t have to worry about handpicking single stocks to buy. UTFs invest in a basket of shares and that is all professionally managed on your behalf.

### 4) “It’s too risky for me – and I am still young”.

It’s easy to understand why a lot of young people think that share trading is too risky. You’re right, shares are a high-risk asset. But the funny thing is, share trading actually becomes more and more risky the older you get.

Why? As you get older and closer to retirement, you need to focus on protecting your nest egg – not building it. Imagine if you’re in your 60s and there’s a crash in the market, you might not have enough time left to build your fund back up again…

### 5) “I should be saving for a house deposit instead”.

You definitely can do both at the same time! You don’t need to put your entire savings into the share market, but putting a percentage of your savings in shares while the rest stays in a low risk and stable savings account could be a good strategy to build wealth.

Shares are also generally considered a liquid asset. Meaning, they can easily be sold (you won’t be stuck holding them because you have to wait for an interested buyer) if you want to cash out. When you’re ready to buy a house, it’s simple and quick to do sell you shares to get the cash that you need.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Illusion.png)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/5-misconceptions-about-investing/)

Ingin melabur dalam pasaran saham, tetapi terdengar bisikan “jangan”? Mungkin anda berfikir anda tidak mempunyai duit yang cukup, atau mendengar semua duit anda akan hangus!

Anda akan gembira mengetahui bahawa kebanyakan mitos tentang pelaburan ini adalah… sekadar mitos! Hari ini, Raiz akan membantu untuk mendedahkan lima mitos biasa yang tidak seharusnya menghalang anda daripada mula melabur dalam pasaran saham.

### 1) “Saya tidak mempunyai wang yang cukup”.

Ramai yang berfikirkan bahawa hanya golongan kaya sahaja yang mampu melabur tetapi ini __jauh dari benar__. Dengan aplikasi pelaburan kecil-kecilan seperti Raiz, anda boleh melabur dengan hanya duit baki harian anda! Kini, semua orang boleh melabur!

### 2) “Awal lagi…”

Sebenarnya, melabur dalam pasaran saham adalah permainan jangka masa panjang. Ia bukan cara untuk menjadi kaya dalam sekelip mata. Lebih lama anda melabur, lebih banyak peluang yang anda ada untuk pelaburan anda meningkat dalam nilai.

### 3) “Saya tak pandai…”

Berita baik! Sebenarnya anda tidak perlu tahu semuanya tentang pasaran saham untuk mula melabur. Anda mungkin pernah lihat rakan anda yang menyelidik prestasi saham yang berbeza, dan berhati-hati memilih saham untuk melabur. Kini, ini tidak perlu lagi.

Terima kasih kepada produk yang dipanggil Dana Unit Amanah. Dana Unit Amanah memberi anda peluang untuk membeli saham-saham pelbagai syarikat dalam satu pelaburan tunggal sahaja, dan ia diuruskan oleh pengurus pelaburan professional bagi pihak anda.

### 4) “Ianya terlalu berisiko – dan saya masih muda.”

Sangat mudah untuk memahami mengapa ramai orang muda menganggap bahawa pelaburan saham adalah terlalu berisiko. Anda betul, saham ialah aset berisiko tinggi. Tetapi yang agak lucunya, risiko pelaburan saham sebenarnya meningkat mengikut usia anda – lebih berusia, lebih berisiko.

Mengapa? Apabila anda semakin berusia dan lebih dekat dengan persaraan, anda perlu memberi tumpuan untuk melindungi tabung persaraan yang telah sekian lama dibina – bukan baru membinanya. Bayangkan sekiranya anda berusia 60-an dan mengalami kejatuhan pasaran, anda mungkin tidak mempunyai masa yang cukup untuk membina tabungan anda kembali…

### 5) “Lebih baik saya simpan untuk deposit rumah.”

Anda pasti boleh melakukan kedua-duanya pada masa yang sama! Anda tidak perlu meletakkan keseluruhan simpanan anda ke dalam pasaran saham, tetapi meletakkan sebahagian peratusan sahaja manakala selebihnya kekal dalam akaun simpanan berisiko rendah dan stabil. Ini boleh menjadi strategi yang baik!

Saham juga umumnya dianggap sebagai aset cair. Bermaksud, ia boleh dijual dengan mudah (anda tidak akan tersekat memegangnya kerana terpaksa menunggu pembeli yang berminat) jika anda memerlukan wang. Bila anda sudah bersedia untuk membeli rumah, ianya mudah dan cepat untuk menjual saham anda untuk mendapatkan wang tunai yang anda perlukan.

---

__*Maklumat *____*Penting*__

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah nasihat umum sahaja. Ini bermakna ia tidak mempertimbangkan objektif pelaburan, keadaan kewangan atau keperluan pelaburan seseorang.

Sekiranya anda seorang pelabur, anda harus berjumpa dengan penasihat berlesen anda sebelum menggunakan apa-apa maklumat yang terdapat dalam artikel ini untuk memahami sepenuhnya manfaat dan risiko yang berkaitan dengan produk Raiz.

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah sulit. Ia tidak boleh diterbitkan semula, diedarkan atau didedahkan kepada orang lain. Maklumat tersebut berdasarkan andaian atau keadaan pasaran yang berubah tanpa notis. Ini akan mempengaruhi ketepatan maklumat.

Dalam apa jua keadaan maklumat yang akan digunakan oleh, atau disampaikan kepada, seseorang untuk tujuan membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan di Raiz, prestasi pulangan masa lalu produk Raiz tidak boleh dijadikan panduan semasa membuat keputusan untuk melabur dalam Raiz dan bukan peramal prestasi masa depan yang baik.

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/503020rule.jpg)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/peraturan-503020/)

The __50/30/20 rule__ is a guideline for budget allocation to plan your spending to prepare you for the future and unforeseen circumstances.

Your budget can be categorized into three simple __buckets__:

*   Your __necessities (50%)__
*   Your __wants (30%)__
*   Your __savings & investments (20%)__

__Your Necessities__

50% of your income goes to your needs. Your necessities are expenses which are important and can’t be avoided. Examples are housing, food, transportation, medication, utility bills. Whatever that you need to survive should be parked under this category.

__Your Wants__

30% of your income goes to your wants. Differentiating between necessities and wants isn’t always easy. Simply put, your wants are basically anything that you can live without. They can be the money you allocate for shopping, dining out, hobbies, gym subscription, or anything “extra” that is not essential to living. Hint: Your wants typically involve something that you do for fun.

__Your Savings & Investments__

The balance of 20% is for your savings (including your retirement contributions), investments and paying off your debt. The aim is to create a more comfortable financial cushion in the future.

You can easily automate your savings and investments using the Raiz app by setting up a recurring investment. From the Home screen, click on Invest > Recurring. Simply choose your amount and select a frequency (daily, weekly or monthly).

Note that the percentages in the 50/30/20 are not fixed – they only act as a general guideline to help you with budgeting. You can set your own ratio that works for you to achieve your financial goals!

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/5-ways-to-achieve-your-money-saving-goals-in-2020.png)

The start of the year is the ideal time to make some financial resolutions for 2023. One of the most common resolutions, when it comes to personal finances, is to be a better saver for the year ahead. This sounds easy in theory,but can be harder to achieve in reality.

With that in mind, here are five simple tips to help you achieve your saving goals in 2023.

__1\. Have a concrete goal __

It’s basic but often overlooked — you’re much more likely to shift your spending habits and get better at saving if you have something to aim at. While the particular goal is up to you – it could be a holiday, a new car, or some new clothes – make sure it’s clear and achievable.

__2\. Budget wisely __

A budget is also important because it allows you to see where your money is going. Once you’ve examined your income and expenses, you’ll be in a position to know how much income you have to work with at any given time, which will help you to save more effectively in the future.

What also helps, when it comes to maximising your savings, is to look closely at your budget and figure out how much you spend on discretionary items like clothes, holidays and eating out to see where your expenses in these areas can be trimmed.

__3\. Analyse your expenses __

While reducing expenses opens up more opportunity to save, so does some lateral thinking. For instance, it’s a good idea to keep on the lookout for cheaper deals when it comes to banking, insurance providers or memberships on things like gyms and streaming services.

It also pays to stay on the lookout for cheaper brands of clothing and food, as well as savings on utilities such as power or water.

__4\. Get out of debt __

It’s simple — debt is not your friend if you’re trying to save. Indeed, you’ll be amazed how much easier saving is when you’re not fighting against spiralling debt.

If you’re in this boat, try and get across how the interest on your debt is calculated and when it’s charged as this can help you manage your repayments and avoid paying unnecessary interest. It’s also a good idea — if you have several debts – to try and pay off the debt with the highest rate of interest first.

__5\. Phone a friend! __

Even for the most disciplined person, saving can get difficult at times. That’s why it can help to team up with a family member, friend or colleague who also has a saving goal.

Still, if you do have to do it alone, think about imposing some hard spending rules on yourself. For instance, when it comes to impulse buys, one option is to impose a 24-hour ban on splurgingthe cash after it hits your account. If you impose such a “cooling-off” period on yourself, you may realise that what you wanted to buy was not so essential after all.

done.description: In the world of finance and investing, there are two main sources of income known as active and passive income. These two forms of income represent different approaches to earning money and can have a significant impact on an individual’s financial wellbeing. For example, did you know your investment returns or dividends in Raiz would […]
done.body:
__[![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Blog-4.png)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/learn-what-is-stock-exchange-bursa-malaysia-mr-diy/)__

In the world of finance and investing, there are two main sources of income known as active and passive income. These two forms of income represent different approaches to earning money and can have a significant impact on an individual’s financial wellbeing.

For example, did you know your investment returns or dividends in Raiz would be passive income? Understanding the distinction between active income and passive income is important for anyone seeking to control their finances and work towards their saving goals.

__What is Active income?__

__Active income__ refers to hard-earned money received from performing work such as salaries, commissions, and income from your businesses.

If you have put on some time, energy and effort towards earning that income, you know it’s active income.

While active income provides immediate financial rewards and a sense of stability, it often requires ongoing effort and time commitment. This means if you stopped working, then so will your active income from this business.

__What is Passive income?__

__Passive income__ refers to money received from house rentals, royalties (like how Michael Jackson got paid for his music until now!) or any income that is earned regularly with little or no “active” effort.

Income you receive from investments – could be dividends, interest or capital gains – are also considered as passive income. For example, if you invest in Raiz, your passive income would be any potential dividends or capital gains from your deposits.

__Benefits of Passive income?__

While most people will have active income from their jobs, not all will have considered how passive income can help your financial wellbeing in the long-term. Relying solely on active income can be risky because it is dependent on your ability to work and earn money. If you experience a job loss, illness, or any other circumstance that affects your ability to work, your income could come to a halt.

Passive income plays an important role in building your savings over time. By reinvesting the profits from your passive income streams, you can leverage the power of compounding (link to compounding blog). This means that your wealth can grow more exponentially over time.

__Is Active or Passive income more important?__

To maximize your long-term financial wellbeing, you need both! Without active income, you may not have the initial savings to build passive income, but without passive income, your active income may not go as far as it can. By combining both active and passive income streams, you can work towards your saving goals further and faster!

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/understand.jpg)

Investing can be scary for those who are new to it, including getting your head around the many concepts used when discussing financial markets.

But don’t worry — getting across the basics is much easier than it may first appear. Here are some super simple analogies that can help you get across some key investing terms.

__Don’t put all your eggs in one basket__

When you physically put all the eggs you have in one basket, you are then at risk of dropping the basket, losing everything. Alternatively, you should put some eggs in one basket and some in another. Meaning, diversify your investment. Do not just invest in one asset. Imagine you put all your hard-earned money in Bitcoin, then the next day the price crash…

__Snowball effect__

Compound interest is another concept that can be a bit challenging to understand. It’s usually explained as interest that’s calculated on the initial principal amount, including all of the accumulated interest of previous periods of a deposit or loan.

If you don’t want to get confused by what it means, it might help to think about compound interest as being like a snowball rolling down a ski field — it builds and builds as it rolls.

Here’s how it works. Imagine you have RM100 with an annual interest of 10% compound interest. Your interest at the end of Year 1 will be RM10 but the overall value is RM110. The next year the interest will be RM11 and you have RM121 in your bank account. We can keep going:

*   *   End of Year 3: RM121 + RM12 = RM133; RM12 yearly interest earned
    *   End of Year 4: RM133 + RM13 = RM146; RM13 yearly interest earned
    *   End of Year 5: RM146 + RM15 = RM161; RM15 yearly interest earned

As you can see, with compound interest the total amount quickly gathers momentum, just like a snowball rolling down a hill.

__Growing a plant__

From the snow to the garden, when it comes to the concept of Ringgit cost averaging, it can be helpful to think about it like growing a plant.

An investment strategy, Ringgit cost averaging involves making regular investments over time, for example, RM100 every month, regardless of market conditions. This strategy can be smart because the short-term moves of the market, which can be volatile, are less important using this strategy given it’s based on a regular investment plan.

Like the regular care you need to give a plant to make it grow, consistent Ringgit cost averaging can be an effective way to make your investment reach its full potential.

__Collecting seashells__

Want to understand why some news can impact the stock market? It’s all about perception. And, although it may not seem like it at first glance, it’s a bit like collecting seashells at the beach.

At the beach, there are shells of many different colours and there’s no reason that one type of shell should be more valued by beachgoers than other types. But what if everyone starts collecting purple shells, and no one considers the other colours?

In that case, the value of the purple shells is likely to go up, despite nothing intrinsically having changed about the shells themselves — it’s all about how they’re perceived.

So, when it comes to the stock market, remember that moves in prices are often about market anticipation and perception, rather than changes in the underlying companies themselves.

__07-09-2021 – Berikut adalah beberapa maklumat berkenaan Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

*   Anda boleh menggunakan Nisbah Khidmat Hutang, atau Debt Service Ratio (DSR) untuk mengetahui sama ada anda mempunyai banyak hutang, iaitu, anda berhutang lebih daripada kemampuan. Apabila anda memohon pinjaman bank, pihak bank akan melihat DSR anda sebelum membuat keputusan untuk meluluskan pinjaman tersebut.

*   DSR pada dasarnya adalah nisbah hutang anda seperti bil kad kredit, pinjaman kereta, pinjaman peribadi dan lain-lain, kepada pendapatan bersih anda.

*   Secara umum, pengiraan DSR anda adalah; __DSR = Hutang/Pendapatan Bersih x 100__.

*   Sebagai contoh:
    *   Hutang anda
        *   Pinjaman kereta RM800, bil kad kredit RM400, pinjaman PTPTN RM150.
        *   __Jadi jumlah hutang bulanan anda = RM800 + 400 + 150 = RM1,350.__
    *   Pendapatan bersih anda
        *   Gaji anda ialah RM5,000 sebulan.
        *   Potongan KWSP RM450, PERKESO RM20, cukai RM380.
        *   __Jadi pendapatan bersih anda = RM5,000 – 450 – 20 – 380 = RM4,150.__
    *   __DSR = RM1,350/RM4,150 x 100 = 33%__.

*   __Bank biasanya tidak akan memberi anda pinjaman jika DSR anda lebih daripada 60%.__

*   Jika DSR anda lebih daripada 60%, lihat strategi melunaskan hutang. Elakkan mengumpul terlalu banyak hutang. Bajet perbelanjaan bulanan anda untuk mengesan ke mana wang anda pergi dan di mana anda mampu untuk berbelanja.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/pph4.2.png)

__Falsafah Raiz: Melabur secara kerap walaupun kecil __

Setakat ini kita telah belajar apa itu pelaburan, belanjawan dan simpanan, dan konsep risiko. Hari ini, hari ke-4 Pendidikan Pelaburan, kami akan menerangkan beberapa konsep yang dapat membantu pelabur menguruskan risiko dan mencapai matlamat pelaburan serta simpanan mereka dengan lebih berkesan.

__Perkataan Hari Ini: BKBA__

Akronim singkatan dari Bebas Kewangan, Bersara Awal.

__Pemurataan Kos Ringgit atau “Ringgit Cost Averaging”__

Falsafah Raiz adalah melabur sejumlah kecil secara kerap, walaupun pada ketika pasaran merosot, kerana ini dapat membantu anda menghadapi pasaran yang tidak menentu dan merupakan salah satu kunci untuk memiliki keseimbangan yang lebih baik dalam jangka masa panjang. Prinsip ini dikenali sebagai Pemurataan Kos Ringgit.

Apakah maksudnya? Contohnya, katakan anda mempunyai RM1,000 untuk melabur. Daripada melaburkan semuanya sekaligus, anda boleh melaburkan RM100 setiap bulan selama 10 bulan, walaupun terdapat perubahan dalam nilai pasaran.

Dengan RM100 sebulan, sekiranya saham berharga RM10 pada bulan pertama, anda akan membeli 10 unit. Sekiranya pada bulan kedua saham berharga RM5, anda akan membeli 20 unit, dan seterusnya.

Akhirnya, anda akan membeli lebih banyak unit saham apabila harga lebih rendah dan lebih sedikit saham ketika harga agak tinggi.

__Faedah Berganda – Kiraan yang menakjubkan__

Faedah berganda berlaku apabila anda membiarkan pulangan pelaburan berkembang sehingga anda memperoleh keuntungan atas keuntungan anda. Diberikan cukup masa untuk berkembang, faedah berganda berpotensi untuk mencapai tahap di mana wang anda bekerja untuk memberikan sebahagian besar pendapatan anda. Graf di bawah menunjukkan potensi pertumbuhan simpanan pelaburan sebanyak RM1,000 setahun selama 30 tahun, dengan anggaran pulangan 7% setahun\*\*.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/compounding-bm.png)

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/portfolio.jpg)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/panduan-permulaan-untuk-portfolio/)

__03-11-2021__

The word “portfolio” is used regularly but some have a way of making things sound more complicated than they are. If you haven’t had a financial portfolio, or don’t know much about them, there is no need to be intimidated! A portfolio is just a collection of items or works. If it was a fashion designer, his portfolio would be a collection of his designs.

In financial terms, a portfolio is simply a collection of investments held by one person. Let us guide you in a simple term so that you understand how a portfolio at Raiz can help you reach your investment goals.

__What is a portfolio at Raiz?__

A portfolio at Raiz is made up of one or more unit trust funds

__What is a Unit Trust Fund?__

A unit trust fund pools money from many investors and invests in many assets; or portfolio of assets. Some funds are mainly made up of stocks, some are mainly made up of bonds, and some are a combination of the two. You can think of one fund itself as a portfolio! Funds are usually setup with a clearly defined objective such as for capital appreciation or income generation etc.

__How do I know what is in each fund?__

You can visit the fund factsheet of each of the fund to find out the top holdings. The top holdings can also be viewed from the Raiz app in the Portfolio screen

__Do I need to choose which funds are in my portfolio?__

No. The benefit of the approach at Raiz is that for all our portfolios, you do not need to pick which funds to include. Rather, the portfolios have already been built by our team for you. For example, your Raiz portfolio has 80% Fund ABC and 20% Fund XYZ.

__How can I tell what the level of risk is?__

Raiz has portfolio ranging from Conservative to Aggressive, which gives an indication of the risk profile of that portfolio. If you use our Custom Portfolio option, it comes with an inbuilt risk scale feature, giving an illustration of how risky your portfolio is.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/risk-scale-custom.png)

Risk Scale

__How can I see the performance of my Raiz portfolio?__

This is where Raiz makes it easy for you to see how much you have invested, what your account balance is, and what your investment returns are – all at the click of a button.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/screen_performance.png)

__Can I change my portfolio?__

Yes. You have the option to switch to another portfolio which has not been recommended to you, at any time. Please be reminded that as each portfolio carries different levels of risk, you may be exposed to risks that are below or above your risk tolerance if you change your portfolio. No fees will be charged for portfolio switching.

__Now, do you feel more confident financially?__

We certainly hope that you do! We have many [blogs](https://raiz.com.my/blog/) to help you feel confident financially, and we hope that whatever your investment goal is, there is a Raiz portfolio to help you reach it!

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/small-steps-1.jpg)

__[Click here for English](https://raiz.com.my/blog/not-a-confident-investor-start-small-and-learn/)  
__

Anda rasa anda “tidak yakin untuk melabur”? Jika jawapan anda ya, anda tidak berseorangan! Tinjauan yang dilakukan oleh Raiz baru-baru ini mendapati ramai yang belum melabur kerana masih kurang keyakinan.

Tinjauan yang sama juga menunjukkan ramai yang merancang untuk mula melabur pada tahun 2022. Jadi, bagaimana untuk mengimbangi kurangnya keyakinan untuk melabur dengan keinginan untuk mula melabur? Dan bagaimana pula untuk meningkatkan keyakinan dengan syarikat pelaburan seperti Raiz?

__Mula dengan langkah kecil__

Jika anda bermula dengan jumlah yang kecil, contohnya melabur RM5 seminggu, anda boleh mula memahami cara pasaran saham berfungsi dan bagaimana ia dipengaruhi oleh berita dan peristiwa yang sedang berlaku.

Pelaburan auto-bundar kami membolehkan and mula melabur dengan duit baki. Auto-bundar akan berjalan secara automatik disebalik tabir setiap kali anda berbelanja, tanpa memberi kesan terhadap gaya hidup. Ini adalah di antara cara yang terbaik untuk berjinak-jinak dengan pelaburan.

__Tetapkan target simpanan__

Menetapkan target boleh membantu untuk mencapai tujuan anda. Merancang percutian pada tahun 2022? Ingin menyimpan untuk deposit rumah impian anda? Mempunyai perancangan unutk mengumpul jumlah yang anda perlukan dan bila anda memerlukannya dapat membantu meningkatkan fokus dalam kembara pelaburan anda.

Anda boleh menetapkan target simpanan dalam aplikasi Raiz. Dengan menetapkan pelaburan berkala (auto-labur) – samada harian, mingguan, setiap dua minggu, atau bulanan – ia akan membantu anda menjejaki kemajuan anda dan jangkaan untuk mencapai matlamat tersebut.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/screen_recurring-bm.png)

__Untuk lebih memahami, apa kata anda buat pengeluaran yang kecil?__

Dengan aplikasi Raiz, ia hanya mengambil dua klik sahaja untuk mengeluarkan wang anda.  
Tiada caj yang dikenakan untuk membuat pengeluaran daripada Raiz. Dengan membuat pengeluaran yang kecil selepas anda membuat beberapa pelaburan, anda akan mula belajar tentang proses yang terlibat apabila anda menjual pelaburan anda. Anda juga dapat memahami tempoh masa yang diambil untuk menjual pelaburan anda, dan masa yang diperlukan untuk wang tersebut kembali kepada anda.

Mengembalikan wang anda melibatkan beberapa perkara: penjualan pelaburan anda, pemindahan hasil penjualan kepada ‘custodian’, dan seterusnya ke akaun bank anda. Ia mengambil masa sehingga 4 hari bekerja untuk wang itu sampai kepada akaun bank anda.

Dengan melalui proses pengeluaran ini buat kali pertama, anda akan mula memahami proses yang terlibat.

__Ketahui lebih lanjut betapa seriusnya kami berkenaan isu keselamatan di Raiz__

Raiz dilesenkan oleh Suruhanjaya Sekuriti Malaysia (Lesen eCMSL/A0363/2020) atau SC. Pelabur yang berurusan dengan entiti berlesen dilindungi di bawah undang-undang sekuriti Malaysia. Mereka juga dilindungi daripada pelbagai jenis risiko, termasuk penipuan dan pengubahan wang haram, dan mempunyai akses kepada tindakan undang-udang sekiranya berlaku pertikaian.

Raiz juga tidak menyimpan wang anda. Ia di dalam jagaan ‘custodian bank’, CIMB Bank, yang disimpan di dalam akaun amanah.

Sekiranya muflis (walau kebarangkaliannya sangat rendah), wang anda tidak boleh disentuh oleh kami kerana ia milik anda. ‘Custodian bank’ akan memegang wang anda supaya ia selamat dikembalikan kepada anda.

Kami memandang serius isu keselamatan maklumat peribadi dan wang anda. Semua data telah dikodkan dan tahap sekuriti kami setaraf dengan bank. Tiada maklumat yang disimpan dalam telefon bimbit anda, jadi anda tidak perlu risau sekiranya telefon bimbit anda hilang kerana akaun Raiz anda masih selamat.

Ketenangan fikiran anda adalah keutamaan kami. Lihat [video pendek](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QoqRhxK-4vY) ini untuk meningkatkan keyakinan anda untuk melabur dengan Raiz.

__Teruskan belajar__

Baca lebih banyak blog dan artikel. Belajar sesuatu yang baru setiap hari. Dengan membiasakan diri mempelajari tentang pelaburan, sedikit demi sedikit anda akan meningkatkan keyakinan anda.

__Keyakinan meningkat seiring masa__

Jangan rasa tertekan sekiranya proses ini terasa lambat dan mengambil masa. Ia tidak akan berlaku dalam sekelip mata, tetapi dengan pembelajaran yang konsisten dan pendedahan kepada pasaran melalui aplikasi Raiz, kami percaya anda akan lebih menjadi lebih yakin!

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/economy.jpg)

*   What is Bond?
    *   It is a debt – a loan from investors to a company or government. So, bond investors are paid interest.
    *   Think about this – a loan from bank to you. So, banks are paid interest.
    *   Bonds have a rating, for example AAA – it indicates the financial strength of the company to pay the investors.
    *   Sukuk, or Shariah-compliant bonds, form a large portion of the Malaysian bond market.
    *   As at 31 May 2021, Malaysian bond market size is RM1.68 trillion – BNM
    *   One of the funds under Raiz portfolios, ASN Sara 1 fund, invested 56% in bonds (as at 31 May 2021).

*   Why do companies issue bonds / sukuk?
    *   Companies issue bonds / sukuk to raise money to finance new projects, maintain ongoing operations and expand the business.
    *   This is another way to raise funds aside from going to the banks or issuing new shares.
    *   Why does the government issue bonds / sukuk?
    *   Government issue bonds / sukuk to raise money for development expenditures and working capital.
    *   Malaysian Government Securities (MGS) and Government Investment Issues (GII), which are long-term bonds, are issued by the Malaysian government to raise money for development expenditures.
    *   Malaysian Treasury Bills (MTB) and Malaysian Islamic Treasury Bills (MITB), which are short-term, are issued to meet the government’s working capital.

Bon patuh Shariah digelar […]
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/economy.jpg)

*   Apa itu Bon?
    *   Ia adalah hutang – apabila pelabur memberi pinjaman kepada syarikat atau kerajaan. Jadi, pelabur bon dibayar faedah ke atas pinjaman tersebut.
    *   Fikirkan tentang ini – anda meminjam dari bank. Jadi, bank dibayar faedah.
    *   Bon mempunyai penarafan, contohnya AAA – ia menunjukkan keupayaan kewangan syarikat untuk membayar pelabur.
    *   Bon patuh Shariah digelar Sukuk. Sukuk membentuk sebahagian besar pasaran bon Malaysia.
    *   Sehingga 31 Mei 2021, saiz pasaran bon Malaysia ialah RM1.68 trilion – Hub Info Bon BNM.
    *   Salah satu dana di bawah portfolio Raiz, dana ASN Sara 1, melabur 56% dalam bon (pada 31 Mei 2021).

*   Mengapa syarikat mengeluarkan bon / sukuk?
    *   Syarikat-syarikat menerbitkan bon / sukuk untuk mendapatkan wang untuk membiayai projek-projek baru, membiayai operasi dan mengembangkan perniagaan.
    *   Ia juga merupakan cara alternatif bagi syarikat untuk mendapatkan wang selain daripada mendapatkan pinjaman bank atau menerbitkan saham-saham baru.

*   Mengapa kerajaan mengeluarkan bon / sukuk?
    *   Kerajaan menerbitkan bon / sukuk untuk mendapatkan wang bagi perbelanjaan pembangunan negara dan modal kerja kerajaan.

done.title: COVID-19 Financial Impact – How to Bounce Back with a Budget
done.description: Despite COVID-19 restrictions easing across the country, the economic fallout from the pandemic continues to be felt by many thousands of Malaysians from all walks of life. However, it’s also the perfect time to look forward and make sure your finances are stronger than ever to meet whatever challenges arise down the track.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Covid-19.png)

Despite COVID-19 restrictions easing across the country, the economic fallout from the pandemic continues to be felt by many thousands of Malaysians from all walks of life. However, it’s also the perfect time to look forward and make sure your finances are stronger than ever to meet whatever challenges arise down the track.

Indeed, with so many Malaysians still experiencing employment disruption like layoffs and reduced hours, now is an ideal moment to look at your budget, actual spending, and savings to make sure you can navigate these unprecedented times.

With that in mind, here are some simple and effective ways to budget with the money you have right now to make sure you build a safety net of savings and protect your financial health for the long term.

__Revamp your budget__

When it comes to budgeting, now’s a good time to get money smart so you can emerge stronger and more prepared in relation to your personal finances.

First, you’ll need to reassess your income. When it comes to this side of the ledger, you can split things up into dependable income, like your salary and things like capital gains from shares or dividends and examine what they look like now.

Depending on your individual circumstances, you might find your income has a new baseline if your hours have been reduced or if you’ve been impacted by a layoff caused by recent economic disruption. However, your spending may have fallen more than before COVID, creating excess savings which could be put away for emergency before your expenses increase again. Doing this analysis now, after the forced cut backs in spending during COVID may give you a foundation to start reassembling a sustainable budget that works with your expected income during these difficult times.

__Cut your expenses__

If you’re strapped for cash, the next thing you may want to do when figuring out your budget is look at how you’re spending your money and where you can make cuts. Some of these cuts may have already happened due to COVID with the forced reduction in your discretionary expenses like shopping, eating out, subscriptions and holidays. On fixed costs such as rent, utilities and insurances, you can actively look for better deals or ask for payments to be temporarily suspended or deferred, then restarted as social distancing eases and your financial situation becomes more certain.

__Take a close look at essentials__

With essential spending like housing, it also pays to get creative. For instance, if you’re renting, consider letting out a room to a lodger to help make up a sudden fall in income. Or, if you’re a home owner worried about falling behind on mortgage repayments, don’t hesitate to reach out to your lender about options for reducing your payments temporarily such as debt moratorium. You could also consider refinancing your home loan if that suits your particular financial circumstances.

__Money for a rainy day__

While some people may need to make fundamental changes to their budgets, today’s altered conditions also represent a chance to plan and safeguard against other unknown shocks that may occur down the track.

This is where building an emergency fund now is a smart idea. Just putting a small amount away on a regular basis can add up over time and make a big difference.

How much you should aim to have in your emergency fund will differ from person to person, but it’s advisable that it can cover the basics like rent or mortgage repayments, food, loan repayments, transport, utilities, and phone and internet for two or three months.

__The final word__

In these unprecedented times, being as smart as possible with your money is more important than ever. If history has taught us anything when it comes to budgeting, it’s that being on top of your personal finances goes a long way when you’re looking for extra security and peace of mind in times of greater uncertainty.

done.title: Could compounding return truly be the eighth Wonder of the World?
done.description: While most of us cannot access the seven wonders of the World in the immediate future, we can still access the eighth wonder of the world, compound return.  This is according to Albert Einstein, who said (allegedly) “Compound interest is the 8th wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it; he who doesn’t, […]
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/egypt.jpg)

While most of us cannot access the seven wonders of the World in the immediate future, we can still access the eighth wonder of the world, compound return.

This is according to Albert Einstein, who said (allegedly) “Compound interest is the 8th wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it; he who doesn’t, pays it.”

Imagine you’re out with your friends for lunch, and the queue for a delicious RM10 meal looks rather long. Your friend might say “I am willing to stand in the queue to get the food, but you need to pay me 5% interest per minute until the food is ready.” You agree to these terms for a bit of fun, but the food takes almost 15 minutes to be ordered and made. Guess what? You just paid 200% the initial value of the item, and kindly bought your friend’s lunch. What a good friend you are!

But why did the interest cost so much in just 15 minutes? Compound interest is to blame (or thank from your friend’s perspective).

With compound return, the profit is calculated on the initial principal (i.e. the cost of the food) *plus* any previously accrued profit;

So, after the first minute, you would pay 5% of RM10 (50 cents) in interest.

The second minute, youpay 52.5 cents, since the 5% rate is applied to the new total of RM10.50. 

With each subsequent minute, the amount of interest paid grows, and after just 15 minutes the original RM10 debt will have doubled.

Like Albert says, those that understand compound interest earn it, and those that don’t, pay it. Compound interest works against you when you are paying it to others, usually in the form of debt, but when you are *earning* compound interest, like through a savings or investment account, the potential for growing your money begins to shine. Just like how interest can compound, so too can your investment returns.

While the food example is a bit of fun and jest, imagine the same situation with your hard-earned money. With markets often returning a long-term average of around 5% per annum, over a normal market cycle, one could expect to have double their initial funds after a period of 14to 15years.

However, markets can be unpredictable, and with past performance not being a reliable indicator of future performance, it’s not guaranteed that your investment would double after 15years.

Menetapkan target simpanan boleh menjadi alat yang berkuasa untuk mengurus dan membuat keputusan kewangan yang lebih baik. Ianya juga boleh membantu anda mencapai matlamat kewangan anda dengan lebih cepat dan berkesan. __Langkah pertama adalah memikirkan target simpanan yang lebih khusus__. Sebagai contoh, daripada meletakkan target untuk “menabung lebih”, cuba jadikannya “simpan & labur RM10 setiap minggu” – supaya anda dapat menjejaki perkembangan anda dan kekal bermotivasi.

Target simpanan biasa yang lain termasuk menyimpan untuk deposit rumah, pendidikan anak, bercuti dan untuk persaraan. Jika anda tidak mempunyai sebarang target simpanan sekarang, meletakkan target “untuk kecemasan” juga boleh membantu untuk menampung perbelanjaan yang tidak dijangka atau kehilangan pendapatan secara tiba-tiba. Ketahui lebih lanjut mengenai ini dalam blog kami [“Mengapa anda perlu Dana Kecemasan”](https://raiz.com.my/blog/kenapa-anda-perlu-mempunyai-dana-kecemasan-dan-berapa/).

Sekarang anda telah mempunyai matlamat, seterusnya bagaimana anda boleh mencapainya dengan lebih cepat? Dengan membiarkannya berjalan secara automatik disebalik tabir! Kebanyakan bank kini menawarkan kemudahan pemindahan berjadual ke sub-akaun yang lain.

Raiz juga mempunyai ciri [“Target Simpanan”](https://app.adjust.com/jsr?url=https%3A%2F%2Fye77.adj.st%2Frecurring_investments%3Fadj_t%3D5tn8ue3_g8sxcfy%26adj_deep_link%3Draiz-my%253A%252F%252Frecurring_investments%26adj_fallback%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapp.raiz.com.my%252Frecurring-investment%26adj_deeplink_js%3D1) automatik yang membolehkan anda untuk menyimpan & melabur secara automatik ke dalam akaun Raiz anda pada jadual yang sesuai dengan anda dengan sangat mudah.

Berikut adalah beberapa sebab mengapa ini boleh membantu anda mencapai target anda dengan lebih cepat:

### Target Simpanan automatik boleh membantu anda menyimpan secara konsisten

Dengan membuat simpanan secara automatik, anda boleh menyimpan secara konsisten tanpa perlu memindahkan wang ke dalam akaun simpanan anda secara manual. Ini sangatlah membantu terutamanya jika anda seorang yang sukar untuk menyimpan secara konsisten atau sering terlupa untuk melakukannya. Percaya atau tidak, perlahan-lahan dan konsisten boleh memenangi perlumbaan!

“Tidak kira seberapa perlahan anda pergi, yang penting anda tidak berhenti.” – Confucius

### Target Simpanan automatik boleh membantu anda menyimpan lebih banyak

Anda mungkin terkejut melihat berapa banyak yang telah anda simpan apabila anda tidak perlu berfikir dua kali mengenainya. Jika anda menggunakan Raiz, mengaktifkan ciri [Auto-bundar](https://raiz.com.my/blog/bagaimana-pelaburan-duit-baki-atau-auto-bundar-round-ups-berfungsi/) kami adalah satu lagi cara untuk menyimpan lebih banyak dengan melaburkan duit baki daripada pembelanjaan harian anda. Kuncinya adalah untuk menyimpan dan melabur jumlah kecil secara kerap dan automatik supaya ianya tidak mendatangkan kesan kepada gaya hidup anda, yang akhirnya boleh membuat perubahan besar untuk masa depan anda.

### Target Simpanan automatik boleh mengurangkan godaan untuk berbelanja

Apabila anda mengautomasikan simpanan anda, wang itu dipindahkan secara automatik ke akaun simpanan anda sebelum anda mempunyai peluang untuk membelanjakannya. Ini boleh membantu anda menahan godaan untuk berbelanja untuk barangan yang tidak penting. Satu lagi petua untuk menahan godaan adalah jangan sekali-kali pergi ke kedai runcit dalam keadaan lapar atau tanpa senarai membeli!

“Jangan simpan apa yang tinggal selepas berbelanja, tetapi belanjakan apa yang tinggal selepas menyimpan.” – Warren Buffett

### Target Simpanan automatik boleh membantu anda memanfaatkan kuasa kompaun sepenuhnya

Jika anda menyimpan untuk jangka panjang, mengautomasikan simpanan anda boleh membantu anda memanfaatkan kuasa kompaun, iaitu potensi pulangan daripada pelaburan anda berlipat ganda. Apabila anda menyimpan secara konsisten dalam jangka masa yang panjang, simpanan anda berpeluang untuk berlipat ganda dan berkembang dengan lebih cepat dan lebih banyak. Seperti bola salji yang bermula kecil dan menjadi semakin besar apabila ia mula bergolek!

Untuk lebih banyak petua tentang cara untuk berpegang pada matlamat anda untuk 2023, lihat blog kami [“How to stick to your New Year’s Resolutions”](https://raiz.com.my/blog/how-to-stick-to-your-new-years-resolutions/).

done.title: EURO 2020: What football teaches us about money and investing
done.description: 15-06-2021 Euro 2020 had just begun last weekend. Now all football fans enjoy watching and discussing what is happening surrounding EURO 2020. But how can we relate football to money and investing?
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/football.jpg)

__15-06-2021__

Euro 2020 had just begun last weekend. Now all football fans enjoy watching and discussing what is happening surrounding EURO 2020. But how can we relate football to money and investing?

__Budgeting__

One of the key decisions a manager has to make is to pick only 26 players out of hundreds to be in the Euro tournament team.

This is where the manager does his ‘budgeting’. Having his strategy and formation in mind, he picks players that should be enough to cover all areas (goalkeeper, defender, midfielder and forward) for the first team and also substitution.

For example, the formation is 4-4-2. So the team needs at least 3 goalkeepers, 8 defenders, 8 midfielders and 4 forwards. Others shall be chosen for special traits he wants, such as a midfielder that good in marking or freekicks.

Same as managing our own money, we do [budgeting](https://raiz.com.my/blog/3-simple-budgeting-tips/) for all our expenses. This is to make sure we spend within our means and at the same time, can have a balanced lifestyle – necessity, savings, entertainment etc. The [50/30/20 rule](https://raiz.com.my/blog/503020-rule/) is a good guideline for your budget allocation.

__Diversification__

Go deeper into the forward’s list, we don’t want all of them to have the same type of play and skills. If a striker with speed can’t give us a goal, we go to plan B – substitute him with a good header striker that can be dangerous when we have corner or freekicks.

If we are talking about diversification in investment, we can relate this to “don’t put all your money in one investment.” Because every asset’s value that you buy comes with the market risk – could drop.

There is always an unexpected event. So, by spreading the money into an investment portfolio across different assets, it can reduce the risk that all of them will fall in value at the same time.

__Emergency Fund__

A winning team not only has many superstar players but excellent depth on their squad. Good players on the bench can help during tough times. For example, when trailing goals, we can bring on one more striker to help more on attacking.

With this analogy of the good bench players, we need an [emergency fund](https://raiz.com.my/blog/3-ways-to-build-up-your-emergency-fund/) to prepare for the unexpected financial surprises that may appear in life. Example: COVID-19 pandemic.

__Opportunity Cost__

Did you watch Euro 2020: Croatia’s first match versus England? Croatia lost 1-0.

But could they do better to prevent the defeat? Yes, they should have a proper center forward that can link up attacking play with the good players like Perisic and Modric.

With this, let say they could have 1 goal, which leads to a draw and get 1 point in the group. This 1 point is the opportunity cost that they missed when they went for the non-proper center forward.

This is the risk that when you make an investment decision, and with the benefit of experience, you realise you could have done better elsewhere.

done.title: Fahami Asas Pelaburan
done.description: Di mana saya boleh letak wang saya? Selamat datang ke hari pertama Pendidikan Pelaburan! Untuk permulaan, kita akan belajar beberapa jenis pelaburan secara asas – mengetahui pilihan tempat yang sesuai untuk anda letakkan wang anda.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/pph1.png)

__Di mana saya boleh letak wang saya?__

Selamat datang ke hari pertama Pendidikan Pelaburan! Untuk permulaan, kita akan belajar beberapa jenis pelaburan secara asas – __mengetahui pilihan tempat yang sesuai untuk anda letakkan wang anda__.

__Apakah itu pelaburan?__

Dalam kehidupan seharian, kita selalu terfikir pelaburan sebagai menggunakan masa atau usaha untuk sesuatu yang akan memberikan keuntungan dalam jangka masa panjang, seperti pendidikan. Dari perspektif kewangan, kita lebih fokus tentang pelaburan wang, dengan jangkaan untuk menjana keuntungan dalam jangka masa panjang dari pelaburan itu.

Keuntungan yang dihasilkan dari pelaburan dikenali sebagai pulangan pelaburan.

__Pulangan Pelaburan = (Untung Bersih / Kos Pelaburan) x 100__

__Pelaburan untuk pemerkasaan__

Manfaat jangka panjang pelaburan ialah membolehkan anda untuk mencapai gaya hidup yang anda inginkan. Bagi kebanyakan pelabur, memperbanyakkan simpanan dan pelaburan bukan untuk menjadi cepat kaya atau mempunyai jet peribadi, tetapi adalah untuk mengukuhkan kewangan dan kebebasan untuk memilih gaya hidup yang mereka inginkan.

__Perkataan Hari Ini: “Compunding Return” atau Faedah Berganda__

Proses yang berlaku apabila anda membiarkan keuntungan dari pelaburan asal anda dilaburkan semula, sehingga anda memperoleh keuntungan atas keuntungan anda. Ini menyebabkan pelaburan meningkat lebih tinggi, dihasilkan dari keuntungan yang diperoleh dari pelaburan asal dan pulangan terkumpulnya.

__Jenis-jenis pelaburan:__

__Saham__

Salah satu jenis pelaburan yang terkenal ialah saham. Mudahnya, apabila anda membeli sesuatu saham, anda memiliki hak milik kecil di sebuah syarikat.

Anda juga mungkin pernah dengar saham dipanggil sebagai ekuiti.

Oleh kerana anda memiliki sebahagian daripada syarikat, anda juga berhak mendapat sebahagian daripada pendapatan syarikat tersebut. Syarikat yang membuat keuntungan, membolehkan ia membayar dividen. Ini merupakan cara untuk mengagihkan pendapatan syarikat kepada pemegang sahamnya. Biasanya syarikat memberi sebahagian besar pendapatan mereka dalam bentuk dividen.

Anda boleh membeli saham melalui bursa saham, yang pada dasarnya merupakan rumah lelong besar, di mana pembeli dan penjual menyenaraikan harga jual beli yang diminta, dan apabila dipersetujui, mereka memindahkan pemilikan saham. Di Malaysia, inilah Bursa Malaysia.

__Unit Amanah__

Unit Amanah adalah satu bentuk skim pelaburan terkumpul yang membolehkan pelabur yang mempunyai objektif pelaburan yang sama, mengumpulkan wang mereka bBersama-sama untuk dilaburkan.

Pengurus dana kemudiannya melaburkan wang yang dikumpulkan dalam portfolio yang merangkumi pelbagai kelas aset seperti tunai, bon, saham, hartanah dan komoditi.

Pemilikan dana dibahagikan kepada unit. Apabila nilai dana meningkat atau menurun, nilai setiap unit juga meningkat atau menurun. Jumlah unit yang dipegang bergantung pada jumlah wang yang dilaburkan dan harga pembelian seunit ketika pelaburan.

Unit Amanah sangat penting bagi ahli Raiz, kerana inilah yang membentuk portfolio kita.

Salah satu kelebihan melabur dalam dana unit amanah ialah dengan kos rendah, mereka memberi anda pendedahan kepada banyak syarikat yang berbeza, mempelbagaikan pelaburan anda dan diuruskan oleh pengurus dana bertauliah. Kami akan membincangkan lebih lanjut mengenai kepentingan kepelbagaian dalam siri ini kemudian.

__Wang Tunai__

Wang tunai adalah yang anda simpan dalam akaun bank anda. Ia berisiko sangat rendah tetapi pulanagnnya juga sangat rendah dari segi pelaburan.

Apabila kita bercakap mengenai wang tunai sebagai pelaburan, kita biasa tentang akaun Deposit Tetap atau “Fixed Deposit”. Ia adalah akaun bank di mana anda tidak dapat sentuh wang tunai anda selama beberapa lama dan anda akan menerima kadar keuntungan yang ditetapkan.

Kelebihan menyimpan wang secara tunai adalah anda pasti akan mendapatkan wang anda kembali apabila anda memerlukannya. Namun, ia datang dengan kos pulangan pelaburan yang sangat rendah – mungkin lebih rendah daripada kenaikan kos sara hidup yang mencabar pada masa kini.

__Hartanah__

Tidak seperti pelaburan lain sebelum ini, hartanah adalah objek fizikal yang dapat anda lihat dan sentuh. Permintaan jual dan beli hartanah adalah punca utama turun naik harganya. Terdapat banyak faktor yang mempengaruhi permintaan hartanah, tetapi lokasi adalah antara faktor utama.

Pelaburan hartanah sudah difahami ramai. Di Malaysia dan kebanyakan kawasan di dunia, terdapat kepercayaan bahawa harga hartanah selamanya meningkat. Namun, ini mungkin tidak benar 100% kerana tiada hartanah yang dijual beli setiap hari dan perkiraannya harganya juga kurang jelas.

Kekurangan pelaburan hartanah ialah kos masuk dan keluar yang tinggi, dan kemungkinan anda akan rugi dalam jangka pendek dan sederhana jika pembayaran faedah anda lebih banyak daripada pendapatan yang anda peroleh dari penyewaan. Hartanah juga merupakan aset yang sukar dicairkan, bermaksud untuk menjual sesuatu hartanah mengambil masa yang agak lama.

---

done.title: Fahami Risiko
done.description: Risiko vs Pulangan Adakah ada kehidupan tanpa risiko? Setiap keputusan yang anda buat, sama ada membeli kereta, menaiki rollercoaster, atau memulakan keluarga, semuanya mempunyai risiko ianya berlaku seperti yang tidak diharapkan. Tetapi untuk mengasingkan diri di dalam bilik berseorangan demi mengelakkan semua risiki dalam kehidupan harian, anda juga tidak akan dapat sebarang faedah.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/pph3.2.png)

__Risiko vs Pulangan__

Adakah ada kehidupan tanpa risiko? Setiap keputusan yang anda buat, sama ada membeli kereta, menaiki rollercoaster, atau memulakan keluarga, semuanya mempunyai risiko ianya berlaku seperti yang tidak diharapkan. Tetapi untuk mengasingkan diri di dalam bilik berseorangan demi mengelakkan semua risiki dalam kehidupan harian, anda juga tidak akan dapat sebarang faedah.

Ya, hari ke-3 Pendidikan Pelaburan, kita akan belajar tentang risiko.

Dari segi kewangan, kami mendefinisikan risiko sebagai kemungkinan untuk keuntungan sebenar pelaburan lain dari jangkaan awal anda. Dengan kata lain, kemungkinan anda akan kehilangan wang atau mendapat keuntungan lebih sedikit daripada apa yang anda harapkan.

Peraturan utama pelaburan ialah __semakin tinggi jangkaan pulangan, semakin tinggi risikonya__. Ini dikenali sebagai pertukaran risiko-pulangan atau “risk-return trade off”. Kadar pulangan yang tinggi adalah layak untuk risiko yang tinggi. Tiada pulangan tinggi tanpa risiko sama sekali. Namun, ada strategi yang dapat digunakan untuk mengurus dan mengurangkan risiko.

__Perkataan Hari Ini: Turun-naik__

Nilai harga pelaburan naik dan turun. Berapa cepat turun naiknya merupakan ukuran risiko aset tersebut. Semakin tinggi turun naik, semakin tinggi risikonya.

__Kepelbagaian atau “diversification”__

Kita biasa dengar ungkapan “jangan masukkan semua telur ke dalam satu bakul.” Sekiranya kita mengubahnya menjadi “jangan melanur semua wang anda dalam satu jenis pelaburan yang sama”, kita bercakap mengenai kepelbagaian.

Setiap aset yang anda beli dating bersama dengan risiko pasaran – nilainya boleh turun. Selalu ada kejadian yang tidak dijangkakan. Oleh itu, __dengan meletakkan wang pada aset yang berlainan, ia dapat mengurangkan risiko kesemuanya jatuh pada nilai yang sama__.

Pada hari pertama, kita telah belajar tentang unit amanah. Melabur dalam dana unit amanah adalah cara terbaik dan murah untuk dapatkan kepelbagaian kerana mereka memberi anda pendedahan kepada banyak syarikat, sektor yang berbeza dan juga kelas aset yang lain.

Portfolio Raiz terdiri dari 3 dana unit amanah, menawarkan lebih banyak kepelbagaian kerana setiap dana mempunyai set aset yang berbeza, sector yang berbeza, domestik & antarabangsa, bon kerajaan & korporat, atau wang tunai.

__Kos Peluang__

Anda membeli telefon bimbit mewah, dan dengan jumlah wang yang sama anda boleh membeli jenama lain dengan ciri yang serupa tetapi harganya lebih rendah. Inilah risiko apabila anda membuat keputusan pelaburan. Berdasarkan pengalaman itu, anda menyedari bahawa anda boleh menggunakan wang itu di tempat lain yang lebih baik. Inilah risiko yang kita tidak sedari apabila menyimpan wang sebagai tunai sahaja. Ya, menyimpan tunai dapat mengelakkan beberapa risiko, tetapi kita menanggung kos peluang yang besar apabila kita mungkin dapat memaksimakan potensi wang tersebut di tempat lain.

__Toleransi Risiko__

Toleransi risiko anda ialah berapa selesa anda untuk mengambil risiko. Ini menunjukkan berapa banyak risiko yang anda sanggup ambil dalam mencapai matlamat pelaburan anda. Memahami toleransi risiko anda adalah penting. Sekiranya anda mengambil terlalu banyak risiko dan tidak dapat mengambil kerugian besar dari pelaburan anda, anda mungkin menghadapi tekanan dan membuat jualan panik pada waktu yang tidak sesuai.

__Jangka Masa Pelaburan__

Jangka masa pelaburan merujuk kepada jangka masa yang anda tetapkan untuk berada dalam pelaburan tersebut. Jangka masa boleh jadi jangka pendek, hanya beberapa hari atau bulan, hingga jangka panjang, boleh menjangkau bertahun hingga berdekad. Caruman KWSP anda adalah contoh pelaburan jangka masa panjang.

Apabila pelabur mempunyai jangka masa yang lebih lama, mereka dapat mengambil lebih banyak risiko, kerana pasaran mempunyai bertahun lamanya untuk pulih sekiranya berlaku krisis. Itulah sebabnya terdapat ungkapan bahawa dalam jangka masa panjang, pasaran cenderung untuk naik.

Sebaliknya, jangka masa yang lebih pendek, anda berkemungkinan terpaksa menjual pelaburan anda semasa kemerosotan pasaran dengan nilai yang rendah. Oleh itu, pelaburan dengan jangka masa pendek seharusnya lebih kecil risiko untuk mengurangkan kemungkinan pelaburan tersebut menurun nilainya dalam jangka pendek. Contohnya, pelaburan jangka masa 2 bulan seharusnya berbentuk pelaburan wang tunai sahaja.

Jangka masa pelaburan ini boleh menjadi lebih penting daripada toleransi risiko ketika membuat pilihan pelaburan mana yang harus anda buat. Terutama apabila jangka masa pelaburan itu sangat pendek atau sangat lama.

Portfolio Raiz ditentukan mengikut profil risiko tertentu, yang terdiri dari Konservatif hingga Agresif. Untuk jangka masa pelaburan yang pendek (kurang dari tiga tahun sebagai contoh), pilihan portfolio Konservatif berkemungkinan pilihan terbaik untuk mencapai matlamat anda.

You need to understand first that, dividend, if any, will be declared by ASNB at their discretion, at any time without prior announcement. Typically, they are declared at the financial year-end (FYE) of the respective funds.

For all the three funds above that Raiz is investing in, it may be announced on 31 Mar 2023.

__3) How much is the income distribution?__

You will only know once it is announced on 31 Mar 2023.

__4) How much will I get? What is the calculation? Is it pro-rated?__

The distribution of the dividend is __based on the number of units you own as at 31 Mar 2023__, regardless of when you invest. It is also not pro-rated.

The dividend distributed will be automatically deposited into your Raiz account on 1 Apr 2023 and will be invested back according to your investment portfolio.

__Example;__

*   Assuming;
    *   your Raiz portfolio is Aggressive (80% ASN Equity 3 fund & 20% ASN Sara 1); and
    *   you own 800 units of ASN Equity 3 fund & 200 units in ASN Sara 1

*   ASNB declares dividend of 3 cents per unit for ASN Equity 3 fund & 2 cents per unit for ASN Sara 1.

*   Your dividend is __RM28.00__;
    *   ASNe3 = 800 units x 3 cents = RM24.00; and
    *   ASNs1 = 200 units x 2 cents = RM4.00

*   The RM28.00 (RM24.00 + RM4.00) dividend will then be invested back into your Raiz account according to your portfolio.

The trade suspension period is 29 – 31 Mar 2023 (Wed-Fri). __All transactions – deposits, withdrawals and changing portfolios will be affected and delayed__. The process will only resume on 3 Apr 2023 (Mon).

Last day to withdraw before the suspension period is on 27 Mar 2023 (Mon) before it gets delayed.
