done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/For-eDM.png)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/should-i-withdraw-all-my-money-now-investing-from-our-pov/)

Seorang *Raizer* menelefon hari ini, dan bertanya – dengan sopan – “Saya telah membuat deposit RM1,000 pada awal tahun ini. Baki akaun saya kini berjumlah RM939, telah turun sebanyak 6.1%. __Kenapa? Apa patut saya buat? Patut ke saya keluarkan semua wang saya sekarang?__ Ini kali pertama saya melabur menggunakan wang tunai saya. Harap dapat bantu”.

__Mengapa ia lebih rendah____?__

Dalam pelaburan, ada pasang surutnya. Apabila anda melabur, anda sebenarnya sedang membeli unit-unit saham pada harga yang tertentu.

Harga naik dan turun mengikut pergerakan pasaran saham.

__Sekarang mari kita lihat prestasi pasaran saham____.__

Pasaran AS (indeks S&P 500) turun 21.1% sejak Januari tahun ini.

Pasaran kita pula (FBM KLCI) turun 8.7% setakat tahun ini.

Seperti yang anda lihat, pelaburan pelanggan turun 6.1% — ini secara teknikalnya masih lebih baik daripada prestasi pasaran. Kenapa? Kerana dengan Raiz, anda tidak melabur dalam satu saham. Anda melabur dalam portfolio saham di pelbagai pasaran di seluruh dunia. Jadi, apabila sesebuah saham turun, akan ada yang naik, maka ianya akan jadi seimbang. Inilah kepentingan kepelbagaian *(diversification)*.

__Jadi apakah yang perlu dilakukan oleh pelanggan tersebut? Patutkah dia mengeluarkan semua wangnya?__

Apa yang beliau lihat hanyalah kerugian di atas kertas – ia tidak akan direalisasikan sehingga beliau bertindak. Jika anda membuat pengeluaran, anda sebenarnya menjual semua unit anda. Jika anda menjual pada harga yang lebih rendah daripada yang anda beli, anda akan mengalami kerugian. Jika anda menjualnya lebih tinggi, anda mendapat keuntungan. Beli rendah, jual tinggi. Oleh itu, daripada memberitahunya untuk membuat pengeluaran, kami menasihati beliau untuk mengambil peluang ke atas harga semasa yang sedang rendah (lebih murah). Beli lebih banyak unit supaya kos purata seunit menjadi lebih rendah jadi apabila pasaran melantun semula, anda akan kembali ke zon hijau dengan lebih cepat. Ini sebenarnya adalah [purata kos ringgit](https://raiz.com.my/blog/kelebihan-purata-kos-ringgit-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

Ingat, setiap kejatuhan pasaran pada masa lalu telah berakhir lebih tinggi. Kejatuhan pasaran adalah satu peluang. Jangan terbawa-bawa dengan emosi.

Raiz direka untuk pelabur baru. Kami membantu membina portfolio pelaburan anda, membolehkan anda melabur menggunakan sejumlah wang yang kecil, dan kami juga mengautomasikan proses pelaburan anda supaya anda boleh melabur dengan konsisten. Ini semua adalah kunci untuk mempunyai pulangan pelaburan yang lebih sihat dalam jangka masa panjang.

Selamat melabur!

Pernah tertanya-tanya apa yang terjadi kepada duit anda setelah debit kad anda dicaj? Jom kita tengok apa terjadi di sebalik tabir!

SEBELUM ITU, biar kami jelaskan bahawa __anda hanya boleh melabur SELEPAS akaun anda telah disahkan.__ Untuk akaun anda disahkan, pastikan;

1.  Gambar kad pengenalan adalah jelas; dan
2.  Nombor bank akaun anda betul (dan ianya adalah akaun anda)

Jika tidak, transaksi anda akan tertera sebagai “Belum selesai”.

Selepas akaun anda disahkan dan anda telah membuat deposit pertama;

1. __Kad debit anda dicaj.__

Pada ketika ini, duit anda sudah ditolak, tetapi ianya masih dipegang oleh bank anda. Kami hanya akan menerima duit anda pada keesokan hari bekerja. Di dalam aplikasi Raiz anda, transaksi ini akan tertera sebagai “Sedang diproses” dalam skrin “Lepas”.

2. __Pada pagi hari bekerja berikutnya, bank anda akan menghantar duit anda kepada Penjaga atau “Custodian”.__

“Custodian” bertanggungjawab untuk menjaga duit dan aset anda.

3. __Raiz akan untuk membeli unit-unit amanah saham untuk anda.__

Di dalam aplikasi Raiz anda, transaksi ini masih akan tertera sebagai “Sedang diproses” dalam skrin “Lepas”.

4. __Kami menerima pengesahan pembelian unit-unit anda__

Kami akan menerima pengesahan ini selewat-lewatnya pada hari esoknya. Biasanya, kami akan menerima pengesahan ini pada waktu petang hari yang sama. Sebaik sahaja kami mengesahkan pembelian tersebut di dalam sistem kami, status “Sedang diproses” pada transaksi anda akan hilang. Ini bermakna pelaburan anda sudah berjaya dan akan dikemaskini di “Nilai Akaun anda” pada “home screen”.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/newsletter_marketupdate_netflix_bm.png)

__Berikut adalah beberapa maklumat berkenaan Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

*   Minggu ini tumpuan adalah kepada Amerika Syarikat di mana hasil bon (“bond yield”) meningkat (jadi harga bon jatuh) dan pasaran ekuiti tidak menunjukkan prestasi yang baik. Hala tuju pasaran ekuiti dan bon AS tersebut menyebabkan pasaran global juga jatuh.

*   Malaysia mencatatkan 8,075 kes baru Covid-19 semalam – hari kedua berturut-turut kes harian berada di bawah 10,000 – The Edge.
    *   Sehingga Ahad (3 Okt), lebih daripada 20 juta individu atau 87.6% daripada penduduk dewasa negara ini (atau 63.1% daripada jumlah penduduk keseluruhan) telah divaksin sepenuhnya.

*   Netflix telah banyak melabur dalam menghasilkan kandungan Korea dan pengeluaran asli terkini syarikat itu, “Squid Game”, terbukti berhasil. “Squid Game” telah menjadi drama Korea pertama yang menduduki tempat No. 1 di Netflix Amerika Syarikat – Forbes.
    *   Netflix berkata pelaburan di Korea itu sejak lima tahun lalu telah membawa kepada kesan ekonomi bernilai 5.6 trilion won (US$4.7 bilion) di Korea Selatan, lapor Agensi Berita Yonhap.
    *   “Squid Game” begitu popular sehingga penyedia internet Korea Selatan menyaman Netflix untuk kos yang ditanggung daripada peningkatan trafik internet dan kerja penyelenggaraan.

*   Facebook, Instagram dan WhatsApp mengalami gangguan pada tengah hari Isnin – CNN.
    *   Saham Facebook turun lebih daripada 5% dalam dagangan tengah hari Isnin, meletakkannya hampir pada hari dagangan terburuk dalam hampir setahun.

*   Pengasas Amazon Jeff Bezos mengambil bahagian dalam pelaburan US$87 juta Series B untuk syarikat permulaan (“start-up”) Indonesia, Ula, menandakan pelaburan pertamanya dalam sektor e-dagang Asia Tenggara.
    *   Ula mengendalikan pasar e-dagang borong untuk membantu peruncit kecil menguruskan rantaian bekalan, inventori dan modal kerja dengan lebih cekap.

__Anda tahu?__

Hampir 15 tahun yang lalu, pada tarikh ini, Google membeli YouTube dengan jumlah besar sebanyak US$1.65 bilion.  
Kini, pada tahun 2020 sahaja, perkhidmatan perkongsian video itu meraih pendapatan hampir US$20 bilion.

done.description: Click here for English Peraturan 50/30/20 adalah panduan untuk merancang perbelanjaan anda agar dapat bersiap-sedia menghadapi keadaan masa depan yang tidak boleh dijangka.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/peraturan503020.jpg)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/503020-rule/)

__Peraturan 50/30/20__ adalah panduan untuk merancang perbelanjaan anda agar dapat bersiap-sedia menghadapi keadaan masa depan yang tidak boleh dijangka.

Perbelanjaan anda boleh dikelaskan kepada tiga:

*   Keperluan (50%)
*   Kehendak (30%)
*   Simpanan & Pelaburan (20%)

__Keperluan Anda__

50% daripada pendapatan akan dibelanjakan untuk keperluan. Ini adalah perbelanjaan yang penting dan tidak dapat dihindari seperti rumah, makanan, pengangkutan, ubat-ubatan, dan bil utiliti. Apa sahaja yang diperlukan untuk kelangsungan hidup akan dikelaskan di bawah kategori ini.

__Kemahuan Anda__

30% dibelanjakan untuk kehendak anda. Membezakan antara keperluan dan kehendak tidaklah semudah itu. Kehendak adalah apa-apa sahaja yang “lebih” dan biasanya melibatkan sesuatu yang anda lakukan bukan untuk kelangsungan hidup. Contohnya membeli-belah, melancong, hobi dan keahlian gimnasium.

__Pelaburan Anda__

Selebihnya (20%) adalah untuk simpanan (termasuk caruman persaraan anda), pelaburan dan untuk membayar hutang. Tujuannya adalah untuk mewujudkan kusyen keselamatan kewangan yang lebih selesa pada masa hadapan.

Dengan Raiz, anda boleh membuat auto-labur dengan set pelaburan berkala. Dari skrin utama, klik Invest> Recurring. Hanya pilih jumlah dan frekuensi (setiap hari, mingguan atau bulanan).

Peratusan pada peraturan 50/30/20 tidak tetap – ia hanya sebagai panduan umum untuk membantu membuat anggaran belanjawan anda. Anda boleh menetapkan peratusan yang sesuai dengan keperluan sendiri untuk mencapai matlamat kewangan anda!

__Anda tahu?..__

Anda sebenarnya menyimpan dan melabur sekitar 23% (11% oleh anda + 12% oleh majikan) daripada gaji anda, setiap bulan, dengan KWSP.

__Kami berkongsi beberapa maklumat tentang Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

Tentang MyEG – dan DUA lagi perkara yang anda perlu tahu minggu ini;

1.  Saham MyEG jatuh teruk pada 7 Feb – turun 26.7% atau 25.5 sen, kepada 70 sen – terendah sejak Nov 2020 berikutan laporan berita bahawa semua perkhidmatan imigresen yang disediakan oleh MyEG akan dikembalikan kepada kerajaan menjelang 2025. KWSP dan KWAP juga menjual pegangan sahamnya. Tekanan jualan berterusan semalam. Ia ditutup lebih rendah pada 60.5 sen.
2.  KDNK 4Q22 Malaysia berkembang 7.0% selepas mencatatkan pertumbuhan dua angka sebanyak 14.2% pada suku sebelumnya. Ini menjadikan keseluruhan KDNK 2022 kepada 8.7% (2021: 3.1%) – pertumbuhan tahunan tertinggi yang dicatatkan dalam tempoh 22 tahun (2000: 8.9%) dan melepasi unjuran kerajaan sebanyak 6.5% hingga 7.0%.
3.  Saham Microsoft meningkat 3.12% pada hari Isnin semalam, mendorong nilai pasarannya melebihi USD 2 trilion, selepas ia mengumumkan pelayar carian Bing berkuasa kecerdasan buatan (AI) barunya minggu lepas.
    *   Saham Meta (pemilik Facebook), meningkat 3.03% selepas laporan bahawa Meta merancang satu lagi pemberhentian sebagai sebahagian daripada usahanya untuk menjadi lebih cekap. Meta sudah melepaskan lebih daripada 11,000 pekerja pergi pada November tahun lepas.

Raiz membantu anda menyimpan & melabur – __berjaya menyimpan 5% daripada gaji anda adalah lebih baik__ daripada memperoleh pulangan 5%. Mempunyai disiplin menabung secara konsisten adalah lebih baik dalam membantu meningkatkan kedudukan kewangan anda (daripada kesibukan memilih pengurus dana yang terbaik).

__Anda tahu?__

Syarikat terbesar (dari segi nilai pasaran) adalah Apple sebanyak USD2.4 trillion.

Microsoft di tempat ke-2 dengan USD2.0 trillion dan diikuti oleh Saudi Aramco (USD1.9 trillion).

---

__*Maklumat *____*Penting*__

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah nasihat umum sahaja. Ini bermakna ia tidak mempertimbangkan objektif pelaburan, keadaan kewangan atau keperluan pelaburan seseorang.

Sekiranya anda seorang pelabur, anda harus berjumpa dengan penasihat berlesen anda sebelum menggunakan apa-apa maklumat yang terdapat dalam artikel ini untuk memahami sepenuhnya manfaat dan risiko yang berkaitan dengan produk Raiz.

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah sulit. Ia tidak boleh diterbitkan semula, diedarkan atau didedahkan kepada orang lain. Maklumat tersebut berdasarkan andaian atau keadaan pasaran yang berubah tanpa notis. Ini akan mempengaruhi ketepatan maklumat.

Dalam apa jua keadaan maklumat yang akan digunakan oleh, atau disampaikan kepada, seseorang untuk tujuan membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan di Raiz, prestasi pulangan masa lalu produk Raiz tidak boleh dijadikan panduan semasa membuat keputusan untuk melabur dalam Raiz dan bukan peramal prestasi masa depan yang baik.

done.title: Pertumbuhan Pinjaman Bank Turun (minggu berakhir 03/08/2021)
done.description: Berikut adalah beberapa maklumat berkenaan Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/building.jpg)

__Berikut adalah beberapa maklumat berkenaan Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

*   Pertumbuhan pinjaman bank secara keseluruhan turun kepada 3. 4% tahun ke tahun pada Jun-21, pertumbuhan paling perlahan yang direkodkan sejak Disember-20.
    *   Penurunan itu disebabkan terutamanya oleh kesederhanaan dalam pinjaman isi rumah (Mei 6. 1%, Jun 5.2% tahun ke tahun) terutamanya untuk pinjaman kereta penumpang, kediaman dan kad kredit.
    *   Pertumbuhan pinjaman ini telah terjejas oleh lockdown yang dilanjutkan sejak 1 Jun lalu.
    *   Lockdown yang berterusan akan menjadi risiko kelembapan utama bagi ekonomi untuk pulih semula kerana pengguna akan lebih berhati-hati untuk berbelanja akibat ketidakpastian yang semakin meningkat.

*   Bank Negara berkata nisbah pinjaman tidak berbayar sektor perbankan akan kekal stabil secara amnya dalam tempoh terdekat – memandangkan bank terus memudahkan bantuan pembayaran balik bagi peminjam yang sedang menghadapi masalah kewangan.
    *   Nisbah pinjaman tidak berbayar kasar dan bersih masing-masing kekal tidak berubah pada 1.6% dan 1% disebalik peningkatan bulanan yang kecil.
    *   Walaupun ia menjangkakan nisbah pinjaman tidak berbayar kekal stabil dalam tempoh terdekat, Bank Negara menyatakan bahawa bank-bank terus membuat peruntukan tambahan terhadap potensi kerugian kredit, yang kini berada pada 1.8% daripada jumlah pinjaman tidak berbayar sistem perbankan secara keseluruhan.

*   Kami menjangkakan Bank Negara akan terus mengekalkan Kadar Dasar Semalaman (OPR) pada paras rendah sekarang sepanjang 2021 dalam mesyuaratnya bulan depan.
    *   Ini adalah berdasarkan keadaan ekonomi semasa yang mencabar, dan ia terlalu awal untuk Bank Negara menaikkan kadar tersebut tahun.
    *   Ini juga berdasarkan prospek bahawa kegiatan ekonomi akan dibuka semula secara beransur-ansur tidak lama lagi memandangkan kadar vaksinasi yang tinggi dan jangkaan bahawa kadar inflasi akan turun.

*   Saham-saham syarikat teknologi China yang disenaraikan di AS bakal menghadapi bulan terburuk mereka sejak krisis kewangan global selepas pelabur-pelabur menjual saham-saham mereka berikutan tindakan keras pihak pengawalselia Beijing terhadap syarikat-syarikat ini.

---

__*Maklumat Penting*__

done.description: Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu   There will come a time when we retire and will need to depend on our savings.  Congratulations if you are a government retiree, you will receive a monthly pension.   For self-employed or private employees, we will be completely dependent on our savings in the EPF and our own savings.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/retirement-2.jpg)__[Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu](https://raiz.com.my/blog/rancangwangpersaraananda/)  
__

There will come a time when we retire and will need to depend on our savings.

Congratulations if you are a government retiree, you will receive a monthly pension. 

For self-employed or private employees, we will be completely dependent on our savings in the EPF and our own savings.

1.  __When will you retire?__

One of the aspects you need to know is your investment horizon. If you start at age 25 and want investment returns at age 65, your investment horizon is 40 years.

The earlier, the better because you will get an advantage of the compounding effect. The graph below shows a projected investment return of RM125 per month at a profit of 5% per annum – much more if you start earlier!  
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/graph_savings-age_en.png)  

2.  __How much money will you spend at that time?__

Lifestyle and needs during retirement might change. When you retire, there are things you no longer must spend on like transportation to work (petrol, toll, etc.). But you might spend on traveling which will use a lot of money. It should also be kept in mind, you may have to pay off outstanding debts such as home and car loans.

So, look at your savings again – is it enough or not?

It is also important to remember the inflation that can cause the price of goods to rise in the next 20-30 years.

3.  __Automate your retirement savings__

We are human beings, sometimes we forget. Especially, saving money requires consistent discipline. For your convenience, you can automatically deposit the savings for your retirement fund.

If you have already contributed to the EPF, congratulations to you. If you want more, you can set it in the Raiz app;

1.  Click [here](https://app.adjust.com/jsr?url=https%3A%2F%2Fye77.adj.st%2Frecurring_investments%3Fadj_t%3D5tn8ue3_g8sxcfy%26adj_deep_link%3Draiz-my%253A%252F%252Frecurring_investments%26adj_fallback%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapp.raiz.com.my%252Frecurring-investment%26adj_deeplink_js%3D1) to open Recurring Investment.
2.  Set name (eg: Retirement) and savings goal.
3.  Set total and frequency of the investment.

We will have peace of mind if we have a sufficient retirement fund. We also do not have to depend on children or relatives later. Remember, children are not our retirement fund!

Let’s build our retirement fund!

---

__Berikut adalah beberapa maklumat berkenaan Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

*   PropertyGuru mengambilalih iProperty Malaysia dengan memiliki kesemua saham REA Group dalam iProperty.
    *   PropertyGuru adalah syarikat pemula (“start-up company) hartanah Singapura.
    *   REA Group yang berpangkalan di Australia, dimiliki oleh syarikat News Corp (yang juga dimiliki oleh Rupert Murdoch), juga akan mendapat 18% kepentingan ekuiti dalam PropertyGuru.

*   Pergerakan FBM KLCI untuk 1 minggu lalu;
    *   Isnin, 24 Mei – 1,571.8
    *   Tue, 25 Mei – 1,577.8 ↑
    *   Wed, 26 Mei – cuti umum, bursa ditutup.
    *   Khamis, 27 Mei – 1,593.9 ↑
    *   Jumaat, 28 Mei – 1,594.4 ↑
    *   Sat, 29 Mei – cuti umum, bursa ditutup.
    *   Matahari, 30 Mei – cuti umum, bursa ditutup.
    *   Isnin, 31 Mei – 1,583.6 ↓

*   Indeks jatuh sebanyak 1.6% sebelum ditutup pada -0.7% (1,583.6 mata) disebabkan kebimbangan terhadap kerugian ekonomi yang disebabkan oleh “total lockdown” di seluruh negara yang baru sahaja diumumkan.
    *   Raiz, sebagai entiti berlesen oleh SC, akan kekal beroperasi seperti biasa sepanjang tempoh ‘lockdown’ tetapi dengan SOP terhad.

*   App untuk menyimpan dan melabur, Acorns, akan menjadi syarikat senaraian awam dengan nilai lebih USD2 bilion di Amerika Syarikat – CNBC.
    *   Ia telah menarik pelaburan seperti dari PayPal Ventures, BlackRock, Ashton Kutcher, Jennifer Lopez dan Dwayne Johnson.

Time flies. Back in January;

“This year, I want to lose 10kg.” But in May (after Raya!), we gained 5kg instead…

It’s time for a check-in! Are you still sticking to those New Year’s resolutions? If not, how can you get your goals back on track?

No discipline on saving the RM500 a month? Do it automatically using the __Raiz Recurring Investment__ feature. This way helps you to save first and spend later with what’s left after saving.

At Raiz, we aim to make your investing journey as easy as possible!. Once you’ve completed the registration and start investing, you might think about what information you can get inside the Raiz app and how it can help in your investment journey.

So, we prepare these three graphics from our [App Guide](https://raiz.com.my/app-guide/) to show some of the ways that you can interact with the Raiz App as you save and invest.

Let’s start!

__Home screen__

The Home screen is the first screen that is displayed when you log into the app. At the top of the screen, you can navigate to the Past and Future screens. Next, you can see your account balance, investment performance, latest blog articles and My Finance.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/screen_home.png)

The Performance screen shows you how your Raiz balance has changed over time. By clicking and dragging your finger across the graph, you can see information about your balance at different dates. At the bottom of the screen, you can change the time period to view your balance, starting at 1 month on the left, and then moving to 3 months, 6 months, 1 year or All-Time.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/screen_performance.png)

__Past screen__

The Past tab is located at the top of the Home screen. The Past tab shows status of your transactions – any pending and processed deposit (Buy) or withdrawal (Sell).

To cancel transactions that are still pending, simply tap on a pending transaction and tap “Cancel transaction”. Please note that if the “Cancel transaction” button does not appear, your investment is being processed and can no longer be cancelled.

Raiz muncul di slot berita Buletin Utama, TV3. Dengan tajuk berita, __‘Raiz tawar pelaburan mudah menerusi wang baki pengguna’__, Raiz membolehkan orang ramai melabur secara kecil-kecilan dan konsisten dengan hanya menggunakan wang baki perbelanjaan harian mereka.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Blog_RaizKids_v2.png)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/raiz-kids-melabur-untuk-masa-depan-si-kecil-anda/)

Raiz Kids is a simple way to save and invest small amounts regularly for your children and/or dependents.

We understand that life gets busy and messy, especially when you have little ones. For the parents and grandparents in our Raiz community, we know it is not simple to get started on a savings fund for your kids.

__What is Raiz Kids?__

Raiz Kids is a simple way to save and invest for your children and/or dependents who are under the age of 18. __Raiz Kids is not a separate account for your child__. Instead, Raiz Kids sits within your current Raiz account as a feature in the menu.

Just like your Raiz account balance, you can __invest your spare change from everyday purchases__, set up a recurring or lump sum deposit towards your Raiz Kids.

__How does it work?__

Raiz Kids works by using your pre-existing Raiz account. Through the Raiz app on your mobile or desktop, you can select the portion of your balance that goes towards the Raiz Kids saving goals. At any time, you can split the portion of your current balance to Raiz Kids. Raiz Kids will then __equally split__ among the dependents you have added.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/1-5.png)

For example, if you select 50% of your total balance to go towards your Raiz Kids and your balance is RM1,000, then RM500will go towards your Raiz Kids goals. If you then put in RM10 recurring deposit, 50% of this (RM5) will also go towards the Raiz Kids goals.

Once your Raiz Kids reach the age of 18, you will then have the option of these savingsto be transferred into their Raiz account. Otherwise, the moneywill remain within your Raiz account until you request a transfer.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/6b.png)

__Why use Raiz Kids?__

With Raiz Kids, you can apply the same Raiz philosophy of investing small amounts regularly, watching it grow for you and your children in the background of life.

__Learn to save and invest without affecting your lifestyle__ by automatically saving and investing small amounts for your kids in the background of life with Raiz Kids!

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Blog_RaizKids_BM-1.jpg)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/raiz-kids-invest-in-your-kids-future/)

Raiz Kids adalah kaedah mudah untuk menyimpan & melabur untuk si kecil anda.

Kami memahami bahawa kehidupan menjadi sibuk dan tidak teratur dengan si kecil. Bagi ibu bapa mahupun datuk nenek dalam komuniti Raiz kami, kami tahu bahawa tidak mudah untuk mula dan mengurus dana simpanan untuk mereka.

__Apakah itu Raiz Kids?__

Raiz Kids adalah cara mudah untuk menyimpan dan melabur untuk si kecil anda yang berumur di bawah 18 tahun. __Raiz Kids bukanlah akaun yang berasingan.__ Ianya adalah sebahagian daripada akaun Raiz anda sebagai sub-akaun baru.

Sama seperti akaun Raiz anda, anda boleh menyimpan & melabur menggunakan duit baki harian anda, set pelaburan berkala harian, mingguan, bulanan, ataupun melabur sekaligus ke dalam akaun Raiz Kids anda.

__Bagaimana Raiz Kids berfungsi?__

Melalui akaun Raiz anda yang sedia ada, buka akaun Raiz Kids untuk si kecil anda (hanya set Nama dan Tarik Lahir). Kemudian set peratusan simpanan Raiz Kids anda. Setiap kali anda membuat deposit ke dalam akaun Raiz anda, peratusan ini akan masuk ke dalam akaun Raiz Kids.

Anda boleh membuka lebih dari satu akaun Raiz Kids – kami akan membahagikan simpanan tersebut secara sama rata kepada bilangan “kids” yang telah anda buka mengikut peratusan yang telah anda set kan.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/1-5.png)

Contohnya, jika anda menetapkan RM100 daripada baki akaun Raiz anda yang berjumlah RM1,000, 10% (RM100/RM1,000) daripadanya akan diletakkan dalam Raiz Kids. Apabila anda membuat deposit RM10, RM1 (10%) akan dimasukkan ke dalam Raiz Kids.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/6b.png)

Apabila anak anda mencapai usia 18 tahun, mereka kemudiannya dapat membuka akaun Raiz mereka sendiri. Anda mempunyai pilihan untuk simpanan Raiz Kids yang telah anda buat ini untuk dipindahkan ke dalam akaun mereka. Jika tidak, simpanan ini akan kekal di dalam akaun anda – ia tidak akan dipindahkan tanpa izin anda.

__Apakah kelebihan menggunakan Raiz Kids?__

Melalui Raiz Kids, anda dapat menerapkan falsafah Raiz yang sama iaitu “sikit-sikit, lama-lama jadi bukit”. Lihat ia berkembang untuk si kecil tanpa memberi kesan kepada gaya hidup anda.

Bergantung kepada usia si kecil, anda boleh melihat anggaran matlamat simpanan si kecil apabila mereka mencapai umur 18 tahun.

Perlu diingat, prestasi masa lalu bukanlah petunjuk untuk pulangan masa hadapan. Namun, kami percaya pelaburan secara konsisten,  walaupun dengan amaun yang kecil, adalah salah satu kunci untuk membina simpanan yang lebih sihat dalam jangka masa panjang.

__

Akan tiba satu masa dimana kita akan bersara dan akan bergantung kepada wang tabungan yang ada.

Tahniah jika anda pesara kerajaan, anda menerima pencen bulanan. Untuk pekerja sendiri atau swasta, kita akan bergantung sepenuhnya kepada wang tabungan kita di KWSP atau tabungan sendiri.

1.  __Bilakah anda akan bersara?__

Antara aspek yang anda perlu tahu ialah jangka masa pelaburan (*investment horizon*) anda. Jika anda bermula pada umur 25 tahun dan nakkan hasil pelaburan pada umur 65 tahun, jangka masa pelaburan anda ialah 40 tahun.

Mula lagi awal, lagi bagus kerana anda akan dapat memanfaatkan kuasa kompaun (*compounding effect*). Graf di bawah menunjukkan unjuran hasil pelaburan sebanyak RM125 sebulan pada keuntungan 5% setahun – jauh lebih banyak jika anda bermula lebih awal!

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/graph_savings-age_bm.png)

2.  __Berapa wang yang anda akan berbelanja nanti?__

Gaya hidup dan keperluan semasa bersara bakal berubah. Apabila bersara, ada perkara yang anda tidak perlu lagi berbelanja seperti pengangkutan ke tempat kerja (minyak, tol, dll.), tetapi anda mungkin suka menghabiskan masa dengan melancong yang akan menggunakan banyak wang. Harus juga diingat, anda mungkin perlu melunaskan hutang-hutang tertunggak seperti pinjaman rumah dan kereta.

Jadi, lihat semula simpanan anda. Cukup atau tidak? Tepuk dada, tanya selera.

Perlu ingat juga faktor inflasi yang boleh menyebabkan harga barang naik pada 20-30 tahun akan datang.

3.  __Automatikkan simpanan persaraan anda.__

Kita manusia biasa, kekadang terlupa. Lagi-lagi untuk menabung perlukan disiplin secara konsisten. Untuk memudahkan, anda boleh automatikkan deposit simpanan ke dalam tabung persaraan anda.

Jika anda sudah mencarum KWSP, tahniah untuk anda. Jika anda mahu lebih lagi tabungan persaraan secara automatik, anda boleh set di dalam aplikasi Raiz.

1.  Tekan__[di sini](https://app.adjust.com/jsr?url=https%3A%2F%2Fye77.adj.st%2Frecurring_investments%3Fadj_t%3D5tn8ue3_g8sxcfy%26adj_deep_link%3Draiz-my%253A%252F%252Frecurring_investments%26adj_fallback%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapp.raiz.com.my%252Frecurring-investment%26adj_deeplink_js%3D1)__untuk buka fungsi Auto-Labur.
2.  Set nama (contoh: Persaraan) dan target simpanan.
3.  Set jumlah dan kekerapan pelaburan.

Hidup akan lebih teratur dan lebih tenang jika kita ada tabung persaraan untuk kita mencapai sasaran.

Kita juga tidak perlu bergantung pada anak-anak atau saudara mara nanti. Ingat, anak-anak bukan tabung persaraan kita!

Jom bina tabung anda!

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/rollercoaster.jpg)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-investment-roller-coaster/)

Bagi kebanyakan orang, __pelaburan selalunya bercampur-baur dengan emosi__. Apabila pasaran naik, perasaan teruja akan datang. Apabila pasaran turun, mudah untuk berasa kecewa.

Tiada manfaat untuk beremosi semasa melabur. Sekiranya pelaburan menurun, itu tidak semestinya bermakna berita buruk. Malah, ianya memberi __peluang untuk membeli lebih banyak aset dengan harga yang lebih rendah__.

Ini seiring dengan strategi klasik pelaburan __‘beli rendah, jual tinggi’__.

Strategi ini mungkin tidak akan berjaya sekiranya anda melabur berlandaskan emosi. Oleh itu, sangat penting untuk mengawal emosi semasa melabur. Apabila pasaran merudum – dan ianya memang akan berlaku – ini mungkin masa terbaik untuk mempertimbangkan membeli tambahan aset daripada menjualnya secara panik.

Sekiranya satu-satunya tindak-balas anda terhadap kejatuhan pasaran adalah ‘*jual, jual, jual’*, ada baiknya anda tidak menyertai pasaran saham.

Dalam jangka masa panjang, pasaran akan meningkat pulih semula (ya, ianya akan naik kerana ianya sebuah ‘*roller-coaster’*!). Bagaimanapun, risikonya adalah masa yang lama untuk pulih, dan anda mungkin terpaksa menjualnya sebelum ia sempat pulih.

Aplikasi Raiz membolehkan anda melabur secara automatik dan berkala. Ia sangat berguna untuk memastikan anda melabur tanpa mengikut perasaan, dan pada yang yang sama membolehkan anda melabur menggunakan [Purata Kos Ringgit](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/221220_Market-Update-BM.png)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/one-thing-you-need-to-know-this-week-for-next-year-weekly-ended-20-12-2022/)

__Kami berkongsi beberapa maklumat tentang Pelaburan dan Ekonomi:__

SATU perkara yang anda perlu tahu minggu ini – untuk tahun depan.

*   Satu tahun yang agak huru-hara akan berakhir. __Adakah 2023 akan menjadi satu lagi tahun ketidakstabilan geopolitik yang bakal memberi kesan kepada pasaran? Atau adakah tahun depan akan membawa sedikit kestabilan?__

Tiga isu utama yang bakal memainkan peranan utama – inflasi & bank pusat, Rusia vs Ukraine, dan kesan berterusan COVID – terutamanya di China.

1.  __Inflasi tinggi__: Kadar faedah telah meningkat dengan ketara sepanjang tahun ini – kerana tindak balas bank pusat terhadap inflasi yang tinggi. Kadar pinjaman adalah lebih tinggi berbanding setahun yang lalu. Kesan kenaikan kadar faedah ini dapat dilihat pada tingkah laku pengguna, pelan pelaburan syarikat dan harga aset.
2.  __Rusia vs Ukraine__: Perang ini juga kekal sebagai jalan cerita utama bagi ekonomi global. Bekalan gas asli Rusia yang terhad akan mewujudkan krisis tenaga di Eropah. Krisis ini boleh menyebabkan beberapa ekonomi Eropah mengalami kemelesetan, dan itu akan memberi implikasi besar bukan sahaja kepada ekonomi tersebut, tetapi juga untuk rakan dagangan mereka.
3.  __COVID dan China__: Covid masih lagi relevan – dalam konteks China. Jika China berjaya membuka semula ekonominya, ia bakal mengurangkan gangguan rantaian bekalan global dan berpotensi mengatasi kesan inflasi tetapi juga boleh menaikkan harga komoditi dan tenaga. China, yang ekonominya bernilai AS$17 trillion, akan memberi tumpuan untuk menstabilkan ekonominya pada 2023.

Raiz membantu anda menyimpan & melabur – __berjaya menyimpan 5% daripada gaji anda adalah lebih baik__ daripada memperoleh pulangan 5%. Mempunyai disiplin menabung secara konsisten adalah lebih baik dalam membantu meningkatkan kedudukan kewangan anda (daripada kesibukan memilih pengurus dana yang terbaik).

__Anda tahu?__

__Ekonomi Terbesar__

5 negara ekonomi terbesar dunia adalah – AS, China, Jepun, Jerman dan UK.

done.title: Should You Prioritise Spending Less or Earning More
done.description: It’s one of those eternal financial questions with no easy answer — is it better to focus on earning more or prioritise spending less?  While most personal finance advice focuses on cutting expenses, it’s also a good financial strategy to find ways to boost your earnings. Or, ideally, do both at the same time.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/should-you-prioritise-spending-less-or-earning-more.png)

It’s one of those eternal financial questions with no easy answer — is it better to focus on earning more or prioritise spending less?

While most personal finance advice focuses on cutting expenses, it’s also a good financial strategy to find ways to boost your earnings. Or, ideally, do both at the same time.

__Spending less__

There’s no reason to wait on cutting your spending back — you can spend less immediately. It doesn’t take any special financial knowledge and you can start right now.

For instance, think about scaling back your discretionary spending. This will look different for different people, but it could include cutting back on buying takeaway lunches, cancelling unused subscriptions or returning those fancy sneakers you just bought online.

If you’re serious, it also helps to distinguish what you need from what you want, especially in a society that suffers from so-called “affluenza”. By taking a good look at this, you may also be able to significantly reduce your weekly and monthly outgoings.

However, there is a limit, especially for Malaysians living in an urban centre like Kuala Lumpur, where the cost of living is high. If this is you, it’s likely your fixed costs — things like rent and transport — could be tough to dramatically reduce.

__Earning more__

The benefit of earning more isn’t hard to see — the more you earn, the more financial options you have, which potentially puts you on a path to financial security and abundance. However, one downside of aiming to earn more is that it involves risk.

Often, looking to earn more involves stepping out of your comfort zone, whether that means retraining, changing jobs, starting your own company, or going out solo as a freelancer in the gig economy.

Also, just because you earn more doesn’t mean you’ll have more money at the end of the day. Sometimes it’s the case that you end up spending more when your earnings increase, making fiscal discipline all the more important as you climb the ladder of wealth.

__Why not spend less and earn more?__

Remember, there’s always the danger that you end up having less time — and inferior quality of life — if your increased earnings mean you end up working around the clock.

Ultimately, it’s about balance. Aim to get to a point where you have enough money to spend on the things you love to do while working at a healthy and sustainable level.

done.description: Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu A Raizer called today. She asked – politely – “I have made an RM1,000 one-off deposit early this year. To date, my account balance is now RM939. That is -6.1% already. Why is it lower? What should I do? Should I withdraw all my money now? This is my first […]
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/For-eDM.png)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/patut-ke-saya-keluarkan-semua-duit-saya-di-raiz-pelaburan-dari-pov-kami/)

A Raizer called today. She asked – politely – “I have made an RM1,000 one-off deposit early this year. To date, my account balance is now RM939. That is -6.1% already. __Why is it lower? What should I do? Should I withdraw all my money now?__ This is my first time investing using my money. Please help.”.

__Why is it lower?__

In investing, there are ups and downs. When you invest, you practically buy units of shares at a price.

The price goes up and down according to share market movement.

__Now let’s look at the share market performance.__

US market (S&P 500 index) is down 21.1% since January this year.

At home, our market (FBM KLCI) is down 8.7% year-to-date.

As you can see, the customer’s investment is down 6.1% — this is still technically better than the market performance. Why? Because with Raiz, you don’t invest in a single share. You invest in a portfolio of shares in many markets globally. So, when one share goes down, another goes up, it is eventually balanced out. This is the importance of diversification.

__So, what should the customer do, and should she withdraw all her money?__

What she is seeing is just a loss on paper – it is not realized until you act upon it. If you withdraw, you practically sell all your units. If you sell at a lower price than you bought, you make a loss. If you sell it higher, you make a profit. Buy low, sell high. So instead of telling her whether or not to withdraw, we told her to take the opportunity of the current low price. Buy more units so your average cost per unit gets lower so when the market bounces back, you will be back in the green faster. This is actually [ringgit cost averaging](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

Remember, every market downturn in the past has ended up higher. A market downturn is an opportunity. Don’t get carried away with emotions.

Raiz is designed for 1st-time investors. We help build your investment portfolio, we let you invest using a small amount of money, and we automate your investing process so you can invest regularly. These are all key to having a healthier balance in the long run.

Happy investing!

Anda akan sedar apabila anda mula menyimpan, walau sedikit sekalipun, tetapi berterusan, tabung anda akan dapat bertambah dari semasa ke semasa tanpa anda sedari!

__Perkataan Hari Ini: Tabung Kecemasan__

Wang yang disimpan untuk waktu kecemasan yang mungkin berlaku pada bila-bila masa. Contohnya, ketika pandemik COVID-19.

__Ingat 3 nombor ini – 50/30/20__

Prinsip yang mudah dipraktikkan:

*   Keperluan anda (50%).
*   Kehendak (30%).
*   Simpanan dan pelaburan (20%).

Nombor ini tidak semestinya tetap. Namun, ia memberikan asas yang kuat untuk membina tabiat kewangan yang sihat untuk membantu anda mencapai matlamat anda. Contohnya, apabila krisis berlaku dan wang untuk perbelanjaan keperluan terhad, anda mungkin perlu mengurangkan bahagian wang untuk simpanan buat sementara waktu.

__Perbaiki belanjawan anda__

Sekiranya anda melihat gambaran belanjawan anda secara umum, anda akan segera melihat bahawa terdapat beberapa jenis pengeluaran wang dari gaji anda seperti ini:

1.  Pelaburan / tabung kecemasan.
2.  Keperluan yang tidak boleh diubah.
3.  Keperluan yang boleh dikawal.
4.  Bukan keperluan.

Kuncinya adalah untuk menghasilkan belanjawan dengan mencari alternatif dan pilihan untuk berbelanja.

Sebagai contoh:

*   Ramai rakyat Malaysia lupa bahawa bil asas rumah seperti internet dan telefon semuanya boleh ditukar. Dengan menukar kepada yang lebih murah, anda dapat menjimatkan ratusan perbelanjaan tahunan anda dengan mudah!
*   Beli secara pukal. Anda mungkin kelihatan seperti orang gila untuk seketika, tetapi ini benar-benar dapat menjimatkan wang perbelanjaan anda.
*   Cuba bayar awal atau tepat pada masanya – sebilangan penyedia servis akan memberikan potongan untuk pembayaran tepat pada waktunya dan mengelakkan denda caj yang lewat (contoh: Caj tahunan untuk insurans kadangkala lebih murah daripada bulanan).

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/blog_small-steps-2.png)

[__Click here for English__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/interesting-investing-statistics-cold-hard-facts/)

__Berikut adalah beberapa statistik pelaburan menarik untuk anda:__

*   Strategi pelaburan __mudah__ mengalahkan strategi yang __kompleks__.

__Pengajaran__: Strategi pelaburan mudah juga berkesan. Jangan terpengaruh dengan strategi yang kompleks – kerana ia adalah kompleks!

*   Jika anda belum mula menabung sehingga umur __45__, anda perlu menyimpan tiga kali ganda lebih banyak berbanding jika anda bermula pada umur __25__.

__Pengajaran__: Jangan berlengah, mula sekarang!

*   Pelabur bilionair Warren Buffett telah mengakui bahawa pelaburannya dalam Tesco adalah salah satu kerugian terbesar dalam sejarah pelaburannya.

__Pengajaran__: Pelabur terbaik di dunia juga mengalami kerugian besar, apatah lagi kita.

*   Kejatuhan pasaran saham tidak dapat dielakkan.

__Pengajaran__: Kejatuhan adalah ciri pasaran saham, bukan suatu ralat. Tetapi kita masih boleh menghadapinya dengan baik dalam jangka masa panjang, terutamanya dengan menggunakan teknik [Purata Kos Ringgit](https://raiz.com.my/blog/kelebihan-purata-kos-ringgit-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

*   6.1 juta ahli KWSP kini mempunyai kurang daripada RM10,000 dalam akaun KWSP mereka – di mana 3.6 juta daripadanya mempunyai kurang daripada RM1,000…

__Pengajaran__: Mula merancang dengan serius untuk persaraan anda.

*   Jika anda hanya menyimpan wang anda dalam akaun simpanan bank, secara teknikal anda kehilangan nilainya kepada inflasi. RM150,000, 30 tahun dahulu boleh membeli sebuah rumah teres dua tingkat, tetapi hampir mustahil untuk menjumpai rumah sekarang dengan harga itu.

__Pengajaran__: Simpan dan laburkan wang anda!

---

__*Maklumat *____*Penting*__

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah nasihat umum sahaja. Ini bermakna ia tidak mempertimbangkan objektif pelaburan, keadaan kewangan atau keperluan pelaburan seseorang.

Sekiranya anda seorang pelabur, anda harus berjumpa dengan penasihat berlesen anda sebelum menggunakan apa-apa maklumat yang terdapat dalam artikel ini untuk memahami sepenuhnya manfaat dan risiko yang berkaitan dengan produk Raiz.

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah sulit. Ia tidak boleh diterbitkan semula, diedarkan atau didedahkan kepada orang lain. Maklumat tersebut berdasarkan andaian atau keadaan pasaran yang berubah tanpa notis. Ini akan mempengaruhi ketepatan maklumat.

Dalam apa jua keadaan maklumat yang akan digunakan oleh, atau disampaikan kepada, seseorang untuk tujuan membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan di Raiz, prestasi pulangan masa lalu produk Raiz tidak boleh dijadikan panduan semasa membuat keputusan untuk melabur dalam Raiz dan bukan peramal prestasi masa depan yang baik.

done.title: Super Dad Teaches Kids about Money
done.description: As parents, we would always want the best for our children especially when it comes to safety and security. Some of the best things that we can do for them is to lay a foundation that they can build upon to do well in life, and one of them is to teach them about […]
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/superdad.jpg)

As parents, we would always want the best for our children especially when it comes to safety and security. Some of the best things that we can do for them is to lay a foundation that they can build upon to do well in life, and one of them is to teach them about money.

__When to start?__

We can begin as soon as they are aware of the concept of money. Remember, the earlier we start, the better it will be! The sooner we start with savings and investing, the more time we will have to reap the benefit of [compounding](https://raiz.com.my/blog/could-compounding-interest-or-compounding-profit-truly-be-the-eighth-wonder-of-the-world/). Sikit-sikit, lama-lama jadi bukit.

__Lead by Example__

This is important because kids learn from what they see. So, the best way to teach your children about saving money is to save money yourself. Children are naturally observant and will learn many of their money concepts by watching you and copying your behavior. You may also invite them to have simple discussions on the pros and cons when deciding to buy certain things. 

__Make Learning Fun__

Learning can be fun too!  In a Facebook [post](https://www.facebook.com/humansofnewyork/photos/a.102107073196735.4429.102099916530784/1280568135350617/?type=3&theater) that went viral, a man shared his experience learning about money management as taught by his parents.

“Every week I get one dollar for allowance. Then I get to choose the section where I put my dollar. There are four sections: spend, save, donate, and invest. If I put a dollar in the ‘invest section,’ my parents give me two extra pennies at the end of every month. I’ve only used my ‘spend section’ twice! I have way over $10 in my ‘invest section.’ I used to have more but I took some money out and put it in my ‘donate section.’ We used to it to buy food for people who don’t have much money in their ‘spend section.’”

This is a clever way to teach children to understand the big picture of money management. Not to mention, it is also a brilliant way to teach children compassion!

__Raiz Kids__

We understand that life may get busy and messy, especially when you have little ones. For the parents and grandparents in our Raiz community, we know it is not simple to get started on a savings fund for your kids.

So, if you’re thinking to put money into savings for your children in an automated way, [Raiz Kids](https://raiz.com.my/blog/raiz-kids-invest-in-your-kids-future/) is for you! Open your Raiz app, click ‘*Invest*’, scroll down, and go to the ‘*Raiz Kids’* section to get started.

done.description: Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu   Markets go up and down. This is completely normal and is known as market volatility or market risk. The Raiz Philosophy is to invest small amounts regularly, even in falling markets as this can help you to ride out the downturns in the market and is one of the keys […]
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging.jpg)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/kelebihan-purata-kos-ringgit-ringgit-cost-averaging/)

Markets go up and down. This is completely normaland is known as __market volatility__ or market risk. The [__Raiz Philosophy__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-philosophy-investing-small-amounts-regularly) is to invest small amounts regularly, even in falling markets as this can help you to ride out the downturns in the market and is one of the keys to having a healthier balance over the long run. This is the well-known principle of __Ringgit Cost Averaging (RCA)__.

  
How does it work? For example, say you have RM1,000 to invest. Instead of investing it all at once, you could invest RM100 each month into the market for 10 months, despite the changes in the market value.

If for example the stock of choice was priced at RM10 the first month, you would purchase 10 units. If during the second month the stock was priced at RM5, you would purchase 20 units, and so on.

In the end, you would have purchased more shares when prices were lower and fewer shares when prices were higher. The outcome is that you may have invested more prudently than simply investing the money all at once in a lump sum.

Let’s look at the other key advantages to sticking with Ringgit Cost Averaging:

__Avoids Bad Timing __

Investing in one lump sum and trying to pick the best price to enter the stock is known as market timingand is something very difficult to do and get right.

If an investor could have any superpower in the world, it would be to pick the low points of the market. Many have tried, succeeded and failed but no one knows exactly when the lows and highs will happen, and no one can stop unwanted surprises from happening.

Ringgit Cost Averaging can provide a disciplined strategy as it ensures you are not too exposed to falls in the market when you buy at the top; and rewarding you when the market recovers, for buying when the market was falling.

By not depending on the timing, RCA can smooth out the market’s ups and downs.

__Reduces Risk __

Ringgit Cost Averaging is most effective in a long–term saving strategy. As the market moves up and down, ringgit\-cost averaging over time reduces your risks of trying to pick the best times to invest from these swings.

By viewing falling markets as buying opportunities, you can significantly enhance your long-term return potential when the market rebounds.

__Removes Emotional Investing __

People often make decisions based on emotion or loss aversion. Loss aversion refers to an investor’s tendency to strongly prefer avoiding losses to acquiring gains.

Studies suggest that losses are twice as powerful, psychologically, as gains, leading this type of investment mindset to be more likely to make the mistake of needlessly selling holdings and switching to cash in a down market.

By avoiding the media hype or fear in picking the ‘right time’, investors can avoid both the euphoric and depressive investment traps.

Ringgit Cost Averaging strategy is in line with the Raiz’ philosophy and provides a disciplined strategy.

*“We don’t have to be smarter than the rest, we have to be more disciplined than the rest.”* – Warren Buffett

__09-03-2023__

__1) Tiga portfolio Raiz terdiri daripada 3 dana-dana ASNB;__

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/3_1.jpg)

Portfolio Raiz

__2) Bilakah pengagihan pendapatan akan diumumkan?__

Anda perlu memahami yang dividen, jika anda, hanya akan diumumkan oleh ASNB atas budi bicara, pada bila-bila masa tanpa pengumuman awal. Biasanya, ia diumumkan pada tahun kewangan berakhir untuk setiap dana.

Untuk ketiga-tiga dana di atas yang digunakan Raiz untuk melabur, ia mungkin diumumkan pada 31 Mac 2023.

__3) Berapa jumlah pengagihan pendapatan yang akan dibuat?__

Anda hanya akan tahu setelah ia diumumkan pada 31 Mac 2022.

__4) Berapa banyak yang akan saya dapat? Bagaimana pengiraannya? Adakah ia dikira secara prorata?__

Pengiraan pengagihan pendapatan dibuat berdasarkan __jumlah unit yang anda miliki dalam rekod kami pada 31 Mac 2023__, tanpa mengira bila anda melabur. Ianya juga bukan secara prorata.

Dividen yang diagihkan oleh ketiga-tiga dana tersebut akan dimasukkan ke dalam akaun Raiz anda secara automatik pada 1 Apr 2023, dan kemudiannya dilaburkan semula mengikut portfolio pelaburan anda.

__Contoh;__

*   Anggap;
    *   Portfolio Raiz anda ialah Agressive (80% dilaburkan di dalam dana ASN Equity 3 & 20% ASN Sara 1); dan
    *   Anda memiliki 800 unit dana ASN Equity 3 & 200 unit ASN Sara 1.

*   ASNB mengisytiharkan dividen 3 sen seunit untuk dana ASN Equity 3 & 2 sen seunit untuk ASN Sara 1

*   Dividen anda adalah sebanyak __RM28.00__;
    *   ASNe3 = 800 units x 3 sen= RM24.00; dan
    *   ASNs1 = 200 units x 2 sen= RM4.00
    
*   Dividen RM28.00 tersebut kemudian akan dilaburkan semula ke dalam akaun Raiz anda mengikut portfolio pelaburan anda.

__5) Bilakah tempoh penangguhan? Bagaimana akaun Raiz saya akan terkesan?__

Tempoh penangguhan urusniaga adalah pada 29 – 31 Mac 2023 (Rabu-Jumaat). __Kesemua transaksi – deposit, pengeluaran dan pertukaran portfolio akan terkesan dan tertangguh__. Proses hanya akan bersambung pada 3 Apr 2023 (Isnin).

Hari terakhir untuk membuat pengeluaran seperti biasa adalah pada 27 Mac 2023 (Isnin) sebelum ianya tertangguh.

Hari terakhir untuk membuat pertukaran portfolio seperti biasa adalah pada 23 Mac 2023 sebelum ianya tertangguh.

__6) Bilakah hari terakhir deposit ke dalam akaun Raiz boleh lagi dilakukan supaya saya layak mendapat dividen tersebut?__

Hari terakhir untuk deposit adalah 27 Mac (Isnin) – supaya kami boleh melaburkan wang anda keesokan harinya (28 Mac, Selasa) sebelum tempoh penangguhan bermula pada 29 – 31 Mac 2023 (Rabu-Jumaat).

Anda masih boleh membuat deposit ke akaun Raiz anda seperti biasa semasa tempoh penangguhan ini (29 – 31 Mac 2023), tetapi ia hanya akan dilaburkan pada 3 April 2023 (Isnin).

__HARAP MAKLUM;__

1.  Ini bukan dana modal terjamin atau modal terlindung. Harga unit boleh naik dan turun.
2.  Prestasi lepas dana bukanlah satu petunjuk prestasi masa depannya.
3.  Apabila dividen diumumkan, berikutan daripada agihan itu, harga seunit akan direndahkan untuk mengambil kira dividen yang telah diagihkan. Nilai pelaburan anda akan kekal tidak berubah selepas pengagihan dividen ini. Begitu juga apabila pecahan unit diumumkan, nilai pelaburan anda akan kekal tidak berubah selepas pengagihan unit-unit tambahan itu.

done.title: The Investment Roller Coaster
done.description: Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu   For most people, investing comes with a strong emotional attachment. If market goes up, it is easy to feel excited. If market goes down, it is even easier to feel frustrated.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/rollercoaster.jpg)

[__Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu__](https://raiz.com.my/blog/roller-coaster-pelaburan/)

For most people, investing comes with a strong emotional attachment. If market goes up, it is easy to feel excited. If market goes down, it is even easier to feel frustrated.

However, it brings little benefit to attach ourselves emotionally to our investments. Because when investments go down, it does not necessarily mean a bad result. We actually have the opportunity to buy more of the assets, but now at a lower price.

This follows the classic investment strategy of ‘__buy low, sell high’__.

This strategy may not work if you are investing with emotions, hence it is so important to be in control of your emotions when investing. So that when the roller coaster happens – and it will happen – you can consider taking this opportunity to buy more instead of selling your investments in panic. If your only response to a falling market is ‘*sell, sell, sell’*, then perhaps you shouldn’t be in the market.

Eventually over the long-term, the market will go up again (it really will, because it’s a roller coaster!). The risk, however, is that the market could take longer than expected to recover, and you could be forced to sell before that time comes.

Raiz’s automated tools like recurring investments are so powerful because they help to remove the emotion that usually comes with deciding to make an investment, and at the same time allow you to [Ringgit Cost Averaging](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging/) into the market.

done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Raiz-opaedia.jpg)

At Raiz, we know there are many complicated investment and financial words that are not easy to understand. We want to help you learn slowly through some terms that you might have heard in social media, newspaper etc. Maybe you know all of them or you know none, but hopefully, this list can create a new level of understanding for you.

We know there might be a lot to take in, so we are splitting this A-Z Raiz-opaedia easy-to-read into few parts.

__Part 1 (A____ to ____C):__

__Active Income__

Hard-earned money received from performing a work such as salaries, wages (basically your ‘gaji’), commissions, and income from businesses you participate in.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Blog_AIvsPI.jpg)

If you’re wondering, the money you receive from investments such as the [dividend](https://raiz.com.my/blog/faq-income-distribution-for-financial-year-ending-march-2021/) that Raiz investor just receivedon 1st April 2021 can be categorized as passive income.

__Benchmark__

A standard used as a way to measure an investment’s performance. For example, FBMKLCI is a benchmark for Bursa Malaysia. It provides a good overview of the overall Bursa Malaysia market performance.

__Bond__

A loan from investor to a company or government, so investors are paid interest over a specific time period. Just like when you borrow money and pay it back with interest.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Bond.jpg)

Bond

__Bucketing__

Separating cash into different categories for specific purposes. This helps you to track your financial priorities.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/503020rule.jpg)

503020 Rule

One example of bucketing is the [50/30/20 Rule](https://raiz.com.my/blog/503020-rule/). Your budget can be categorized into three simple buckets:

*   Your necessities (50%)
*   Your wants (30%)
*   Your savings & investments (20%)

__Compounding__

The dividend you previously earned on your investment starts earning market returns as well.

Due to the power of [compounding](https://raiz.com.my/blog/could-compounding-interest-or-compounding-profit-truly-be-the-eighth-wonder-of-the-world/), if you were to invest RM1,000 every year for 30 years, assuming average returns of 7% p.a. that investment could grow to be worth RM94,461. That’s a total return of RM64,461.\*\*

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/compounding.png)

\*\*Return estimated for the sake of simplicity as past performance is no indication of future performance.

That concludes part 1.

Stay tuned for the next part of Raiz-opaedia easy learning!

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Raiz-opaedia-D-F.png)

Hey guys! We’re back with Raiz-opaedia – now in part 2! In part 1 (thanks to the many readers!), we’ve covered the alphabet A, B and C. 

Let’s continue with investment and financial words that start with D to F.

__Part 2 (D to F):__

__Dividend__

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Dividend.png)

When starting up, a company needs capital to run its business. The capital is given by investors and in return, the company gives the investor shares of the company. For this reason, the investor is also called a shareholder.

Over time, the performance of the company improves and makes profit, it gives back some of the profit, or dividend to the shareholders of the company.

__FBM KLCI__

The main stock market index on Bursa Malaysia. It tracks the performance of 30 largest companies by market capitalization listed on the Main Board of the Bursa Malaysia. The index provides a good overview of the overall market performance.

__FinTech Startup companies__

Financial + Technology = FinTech

A young company that integrates innovative technology to deliver financial services products. For example; Raiz, Boost and Touch ‘n Go.

__Fiscal deficit__

Money out > Money in = Fiscal Deficit 

Negative balances that arise whenever a government spends more money than it earns during the fiscal year. It is also the difference between a government’s total revenue and total expenditure.

__Fiscal Policy__

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Blog_FPvsMP.png)

Changing the tax rate and level of government spending. Set by the Government.

Part 2 ends. Hopefully, you will understand and feel more confident in your investment journey.

![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Raiz-opaedia-G-I.png)

We’re here again for Raiz-opaedia! We group this by parts so that we can slowly understand each investment and financial term. In case you missed part 1 and part 2, please refer to the links below:

Part 1: [The Raiz-opaedia of Financial Language (A to C)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-opaedia-of-financial-language-a-to-c/)

Part 2: [The Raiz-opaedia of Financial Language (D to F)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-opaedia-of-financial-language-d-to-f/)

Enough with the introduction and let’s get started with part 3!

__Part 3 (G to I):__

__Gross Domestic Product (GDP)__

The total value of everything generated within a country during a specific period of time. GDP growth rate is an important indicator of how a country’s economy is performing.

Let’s say you buy RM3 *nasi lemak* from a stall. The RM3 is part of GDP. GDP measures the total value of goods and services within a country.

__GDP = Consumption + Investment + Government Spending + Net Exports__ 

Consumption: Consumer spending such as the money you spend on RM3 *nasi lemak.*

Investment: Business investment is the total amount of spending by businesses on plant and equipment.

Government Spending: Money spent on public goods and services like roads, healthcare and school.

Net Exports: Export minus import.

If the country’s economy is healthy, the GDP growth rate increases.

__Inflation__

Put simply, inflation is a general rise in prices. If prices fall, this will result in negative inflation, or also known as deflation.

Inflation can be caused by an increase in production and raw material cost. A rise in consumer demand and the government printing more money can also contribute to a rise in inflation.

To beat inflation, you can grow your money through investment.

__Initial Public Offering (IPO) __

When a private company becomes public by selling its shares on a stock exchange.  

When a company goes from private to public, its share can be bought publicly from the stock market like Bursa Malaysia. So, when you buy the shares, you are partly the owner!

Mr DIY (established since 2005) was a private company until it went public by issuing its IPO in December 2020. It sold 941.5 million shares on Bursa Malaysia at RM1.60 per share, raising about RM1.5 billion, making it the largest IPO in Bursa since 2017.

__Sharing some Investing and Economic insights:__

The Balloon Drama – and TWO more things you need to know this week;

1.  The Balloon Drama. A US fighter jet shot down a balloon, suspected to be a Chinese spy balloon last Saturday. China reiterated that it was a “civilian airship conducting weather research” that accidentally drifted into US airspace. This has further strained the already-tense relations between the two countries. US has cancelled the planned visit to Beijing. China has asked US to “not overreact and to remain calm”. Chinese equities fell on Monday. Undoubtedly, this incident will be a negative headline for the market.
2.  The Fed raised its interest rate by 0.25% last Wednesday and promised of an “ongoing increase” as part of its still unresolved battle against inflation as the labor market remains strong. done.title: Timing the Market vs Time in the Market
done.description: You may or may not have heard the saying, “It’s not about timing the market, but time in the market.” But what exactly does this mean?
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/stockmarket-1.jpg)

You may or may not have heard the saying, “It’s not about timing the market, but time in the market.” But what exactly does this mean?

Some investors may tend to place a short-term focus on how their investments are performing. They’ll frequently track how their investments are going, get excited when it goes up, and then, if it falls, they’ll become carried away with emotion and stressed by the short-term loss.

But what about the long-term picture? Over time stocks tend to go through periods of growth and decline – this is normal. Therefore, selling off stocks after a short period of decline, rather than focusing on the long-term goal can be a strategy that doesn’t add value, given it is likely that shares will likely rise in a longer run.

Just as hard as it is to predict the downturns, it is also hard to predict when stocks will turn around and rally. This is known as timing the market – picking the tops and bottoms.

A more long-term strategy is to utilise the advantages of time in the market – that is, the longer you are in the market, the more likely you are to see a healthier return.

__The first step is to have the right portfolio for you__. If you are likely to withdraw your money when the market declines, you should probably be in Moderate or Conservative portfolio. This way, a stock market decline should have a less emotional impact on you, and you will be more likely to remain disciplined with your strategy when markets decline.

If your savings goal is short-term (less than three years) a Conservative portfolio is also probably best.

The Aggressive portfolio is for those with long-term saving goals and the ability to remain calm and disciplined during market downturns.

Having the right portfolio is an important step in avoiding the emotional traps that can cause you to make foolish decisions.

__The second step is to have a discipline__. At Raiz, our philosophy is to invest small amounts regularly, regardless of market situation. Because this will help you to manage market uncertainty. This is a well-known investment strategy, known as [Ringgit Cost Averaging](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

Raiz automates this strategy and you can make it practical by setting up the __recurring investment__ feature. By automating the process, your investing strategy can also be protected against those short-term emotions.

Another benefit of staying long term in the market is from [compounding](https://raiz.com.my/blog/could-compounding-interest-or-compounding-profit-truly-be-the-eighth-wonder-of-the-world/). This is when an investments’ dividend are being reinvested – and generating additional dividend over time. Reinvesting dividends into buying more shares can increase returns due to the power of compounding. So, the longer you spend in the market, the more dividends you are likely to receive, which are reinvested into more and more shares over time.

It is not easy when it is your money. We all experience the emotional highs and lows that come with investing. However, by maintaining a disciplined, automated approach, and having the right portfolio, you can avoid short term stress and take advantage of Ringgit Cost Averaging and compound returns over time.

done.description: Welcome again to Raiz-opaedia! If you’re new, this is the explanation of complicated investment and financial words that you might have heard somewhere.  It’s valuable to have knowledge as the foundation, while you get familiar with your investment journey – that is full of emotion!
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Raiz-opaedia-M-N.png)

Welcome again to Raiz-opaedia! If you’re new, this is the explanation of complicated investment and financial words that you might have heard somewhere.

It’s valuable to have knowledge as the foundation, while you get familiar with your investment journey – that is full of emotion!

In case you want to revisit parts 1-3, here are the links: 

*   *   Part 1: [The Raiz-opaedia of Financial Language (A to C)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-opaedia-of-financial-language-a-to-c/) 
    *   Part 2: [The Raiz-opaedia of Financial Language (D to F)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-opaedia-of-financial-language-d-to-f/)  
    *   Part 3: [The Raiz-opaedia of financial language (G to I)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-raiz-opaedia-of-financial-language-g-to-i/) 

Ready? Let’s continue for the next alphabets – M and N!

__Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A)__

When two or more separate entities combine forces. Examples; 

*   *   Celcom Axiata Bhd + Digi.Com Bhd = Celcom Digi Bhd 
    *   AmBank Group bought 100% MBf Cards Sdn Bhd 
    *   SapuraCrest Petroleum Bhd + Kencana Petroleum Bhd = SapuraKencana Petroleum Bhd

This could happen in many ways;

*   *   Some are direct competitors like Celcom and Digi.
    *   A company and its supplier/customer along its supply chain.

Why did companies decide to merge? It could be to achieve higher growth and market share, diversification to reduce loss, and tax benefits. 

__Monetary Policy__

Policy which the Central Bank control the interest rate and money supply to make sure the sustainability of economic growth.

As you can see during this COVID-19 pandemic, Bank Negara has lowered the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) to encourage more borrowing and spending. And vice versa.

The goal is to keep the economy in the best condition – not too cold or hot, like your *teh tarik*.

__Net Asset Value (NAV)__

It represents the price per unit of a fund, calculated on each business day.

__Net Worth__

The value of all your __assets__ minus all your __liabilities__, or simply your debts. It helps you in understanding your current financial situation to better plan your financial goals. It provides a measure of your progress in accumulating financial wealth and the progress you’re making toward paying off your debt.

__Assets__ – when you add up the value of everything you own (such as your house and the cash in your bank account).

Example: 

*   *   Ali has RM10,200 in ASB.
    *   Ali has a house valued at RM360,000.
    *   Ali has a 3-year old Myvi car, and if he were to sell it, he will get RM20,000.
    *   So, Ali’s total assets are __RM390,200__.

__Liabilities__ – when you add up the value of all your debts (such as your house loan, car loan or credit card balances).

Example:

*   *   Ali’s house still has bank loan balance of RM200,000 to settle.
    *   Ali has a 3-year old Myvi car that still has bank loan balance of RM34,000 to settle.
    *   Ali has RM2,000 credit card balance.
    *   So, Ali’s total liabilities are __RM236,000__.

Net Worth = Assets – Liabilities.

So, Ali’s net worth is __RM390,200__ – __RM236,000__ = __+RM154,200.__

Theoretically, your net worth is the cash you would have if you were to sell everything you own and paid off all your debts. A negative net worth is an indication that you have more debts than your assets.

Hari gaji! Senyum lebar semua apabila dapat notifikasi beritahu duit gaji dah masuk.

Malang sekali senyuman itu tidak lama apabila anda perlu membayar bil-bil, perbelanjaan rumah, yuran sekolah anak dan sebagainya. Sehinggakan duit seakan tidak cukup apabila sudah tengah bulan. Masa itu la mee Maggi muncul di ingatan.

Persoalannya, bagaimana nak urus duit gaji itu secara lebih sistematik supaya duit yang ada dapat memenuhi semua perbelanjaan dan dapat hidup dengan tenang?

Antara panduan yang boleh digunakan ramai ialah [Peraturan 50/30/20](https://raiz.com.my/blog/peraturan-503020/) dikelaskan kepada tiga:

*   Keperluan (50%)
*   Kehendak (30%)
*   Simpanan & Pelaburan (20%)

Namun pecahan peratusan ini boleh diubah mengikut kesesuaian hidup anda secara keseluruhan.

__Keperluan__

Ini bahagian yang paling perlu diutamakan kerana melibatkan kelangsungan hidup anda seperti rumah, makanan, pengangkutan, ubat-ubatan dan bil utiliti. Apabila sudah dapat duit gaji, adalah lebih baik jika boleh terus selesaikan bayaran wajib setiap bulan ini. Tetapkan bayaran secara automatik supaya anda tidak terlupa.

Untuk perbelanjaan makanan dan barang rumah, kini lebih mudah untuk anda menilai sendiri harganya. Contohnya, beli barang online secara pukal biasanya lebih murah daripada beli satu-satu dan masak sendiri biasanya lebih murah daripada beli makanan di kedai.

Mudah mudahanan selesai bahagian keperluan ini, hati akan lebih tenang.

__Kehendak__

Bahagian ini pula melibatkan sesuatu yang anda suka berbelanja tetapi bukan untuk kelangsungan hidup seperti melancong, beli bag tangan ke-3 dan langsir rumah untuk Hari Raya. Kebiasaanya untuk keseronokan setelah penat bekerja. Nak reward diri la katakan.

Jika anda tidak punyai banyak duit untuk bahagian ini, anda boleh menyimpan sikit-sikit setiap bulan untuk dapatkan apa yang anda hajati itu. Untuk ini, Raiz boleh bantu anda melalui fungsi Target Simpanan. Anda hanya set target berapa simpanan bulanan, seterusnya lihat ia berfungsi untuk capai target anda!

Contohnya, anda memerlukan RM500 untuk bercuti bersama keluarga. Anda boleh set RM100 / bulan dan akan capai target simpanan dalam masa 5 bulan.

__Simpanan & Pelaburan__

Bahagian ini juga penting tetapi sering dilupakan. Duit diperlukan untuk kelangsungan hidup, bukan hanya sekarang tetapi juga untuk masa depan. __Pandemik Covid-19 telah memberikan kesedaran kepada kita bahawa pentingnya tabung kecemasan.__ Supaya anda ada kusyen keselamatan kewangan pada masa hadapan.

Dengan Raiz, anda boleh membuat Auto-labur dengan set pelaburan berkala. Dari skrin utama, klik Labur > Auto-labur. Hanya pilih jumlah dan kekerapan (setiap hari, mingguan atau bulanan), siap!

done.title: Want to Save Money? Here are 4 Easy Tips
done.description: Saving can be tough in this current environment, but that doesn’t mean you should give up on building a financial back up for you and your loved ones. While growing your savings surely takes a large effort, there are some simple ways to start on the path to financial security.
done.body:
![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/savings.jpg)

Saving can be tough in this current environment, but that doesn’t mean you should give up on building a financial back up for you and your loved ones.

While growing your savings surely takes a large effort, there are some simple ways to start on the path to financial security.

__1\. Get on top of your budget__

There’s little chance you’ll be able to save much money if you’re not keeping good track of your cash. Therefore, it’s important to create a budget — and stick to it.

When it comes getting your budget started, kick things off by looking at your income and expenses. Once you’ve established your income —your salary and other types of money gains — figure out what you’re spending that money on. This includes fixed costs like rent and food as well as optional spends such as entertainment and non-essential shopping.

__2\. Cut your expenses where you can__

There’s no point in just knowing where you’re spending your money – that’s only half the battle. The key is cutting spending so you can allocate more money to your savings. Although depending on your situation during the current economic environment, it may be a much harder time than usual to do this.

Some common strategies include seeking out better deals on your regular payments — things like phone bills. It could also pay off to switch to cheaper brands of clothing and food or cut down on under-utilised subscription services like Netflix.

__3\. What about investing?__

The Raiz Philosophy is to invest small amounts regularly, even in falling markets as this can help you to ride out the downturns in the market and is one of the keys to having a healthier balance over the long run. This principle is known as [Ringgit Cost Averaging](https://raiz.com.my/blog/the-advantages-of-ringgit-cost-averaging/).

Compounding happens when you let the returns on an investment build up so that you are earning a return on your return. Given enough time to work its magic, it provides the potential to reach a stage in your life where your money is working hard enough to provide a substantial part of your income.

__4\. Build an emergency fund__

Building your savings should be about achieving your financial goals, but don’t forget to also prepare for when times get tough – the current coronavirus pandemic for example. This is where an emergency fund can be super helpful. Click [here](https://raiz.com.my/blog/3-ways-to-build-up-your-emergency-fund/) to learn about the 3 steps to build up your emergency fund.

Depending on your situation, you may need to build a big emergency fund or one that just needs to get you through a few weeks without a regular income.

Whatever you may need money for down the track, it makes sense to prepare for a financial back up in order to soften the unexpected bumps along the road.

done.title: Understanding Your Net Worth
done.description: Have you ever calculated your current financial position? Where is the best place to start? A common way to understand this is by estimating your net worth.
done.body:
__[![](https://raiz.com.my/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Blog-3.png)](https://raiz.com.my/blog/learn-what-is-stock-exchange-bursa-malaysia-mr-diy/)__

Have you ever calculated your current financial position? Where is the best place to start? A common way to understand this is by estimating your net worth.

__What is Net Worth?__

Your net worth is an indication on how well off you are financially. If your assets (things you own) are worth more than your liabilities (things you owe), your net worth is positive, which means you have more than you owe. This is generally considered a good thing. However, if your liabilities are higher than your assets, your net worth is negative, indicating that you owe more than you own.

__Why is your Net Worth important?__

Your net worth helps you in understanding your __current financial situation__ to better plan your finances. It provides a measure of your progress in accumulating financial wealth and the progress you’re making toward paying off your debt.

By understanding your net worth, you can get a bigger picture of making better financial decisions, tracking your progress, and working towards building long-term wealth and financial security.

__How to calculate your net worth?__

Your net worth is a total of all __your assets minus your liabilities.__ In the below, we will use an example to calculate Ali’s net worth. Firstly, we will take a look at Ali’s assets.

__Assets__ – when you add up the value of everything you __own__ (such as your house and the cash in your bank account).

Example:

*   Ali has RM10,200 cash in ASB.
*   Ali has a house valued at RM360,000.
*   Ali has a 3-year old Myvi car, and if he were to sell it now, he will get RM20,000.
*   So, Ali’s total assets are RM390,200.

Next, we will look at Ali’s liabilities.

__Liabilities__ – when you add up the value of all your __debts__ (such as your house loan, car loan or credit card balances).

Example:

*   Ali’s house still has bank loan balance of RM200,000 to settle.
*   Ali has a 3-year old Myvi car that still has bank loan balance of RM34,000 to settle.
*   Ali has RM2,000 credit card balance.
*   So, Ali’s total liabilities are RM236,000.

__Net Worth = Assets – Liabilities.__

So, Ali’s __net worth__ is RM390,200 – RM236,000 = __+RM154,200__.

Theoretically, your net worth is the cash you would have if you were to sell everything you own and paid off all your debts. A negative net worth is an indication that you have more debts than your assets.

In summary, calculating your net worth is essential because it provides a comprehensive snapshot of your financial standing. By assessing your assets and liabilities, net worth enables you to set meaningful financial goals and make informed decisions about saving, investing, and borrowing. Like market conditions, your net worth will change throughout your life so it’s important to keep track and reassess if you are still working towards your saving goals.

Ever wonder what happens to your money right after you have made your first deposit? Let’s take a look behind the scenes!

But BEFORE that, let’s be clear that __you can only invest AFTER your account has been verified__. In order to get your account verified, please make sure when you register;

1.  Your IC photo is clear; and
2.  Your bank account number is correct (and it is yours).

Or else, you will see your transaction as “Pending”.

After your account has been verified and you have made your first deposit;

1. __Your debit card is charged.__

At this stage, your money has been taken out from your bank account, but it is still with your bank. It will only reach us the next working day. Your app will tell you that your transaction is “Processing” in the “Past” screen.

2. __The next working day, your bank will transfer your money to our Custodian in the morning.__

The Custodian is responsible to safeguard your money and asset.

3. __Raiz will then proceed to buy your units.__

Note that your transaction status is still “Processing” at this stage.

4. __Raiz will receive the confirmation that your units have been purchased__

We will receive this confirmation the latest on the next working day, though this is usually received on the same day. We will then update it in our system. As soon as we do that, your “Processing” status will disappear – this means that your investment has been confirmed! You will now see your investment account value on the home screen.

Still have some questions about this? Please reach out to us by writing to [help@raiz.com.my](mailto:help@raiz.com.my).
